to reduce the prices―cut down the prices

content:
ていこう〔抵抗〕
〈名〉Resistance; opposition; defiance:(=する) to resist (an attack); to stand against (the enemy); to fight against (odds); to contend against (superior numbers); to struggle against (oppression); to strive against (fate); to mutiny against (authority); to fly in the face of (justice); to oppose (a measure); to defy (the law); to antagonize (a force):(首尾好く抵抗するは) to withstand (the onset of the enemy); to make head against (the enemy)

content.content: 攻撃に抵抗する
to resist an attack―(首尾好くなら)―withstand an attack
敵は我が軍の攻撃に抵抗しかねて退却した
The enemy, unable to withstand our attacks, retreated.
敵に抵抗する
to resist the enemy―stand against the enemy―(首尾好くなら)―make head against the enemy
烏合の衆は正規軍に抵抗することができぬ
A rabble can not make head against regular troops.
優勢の敵に抵抗する
to contend against superior numbers―fight against odds
圧制に抵抗する
to struggle against oppression
運命に抵抗するは愚
It is vain to strive against fate.
上官に抵抗する
to mutiny against authority
上官抵抗(罪)
mutiny
上官抵抗者
a mutineer
公然官吏に抵抗する
to fly in the face of justice
お前は官吏に抵抗する気か
Do you mean to fly in the face of justice?
抵抗を試みる
to offer resistance―make a resistance
敵は頑強に抵抗した
The enemy made an obstinate resistance―offered a stout resistance.
死力を尽して抵抗した
They made a desperate resistance.
被害者はよほど抵抗した形跡がある
There are signs of strong resistance having been made by the victim.
敵は抵抗せずに退却した
The enemy retreated without offering any resistance.
敵は抵抗せずに降参した
The enemy surrendered without firing a shot.
我が軍は抵抗を受けずに上陸した
We landed unopposed―without meeting with any resistance.
抵抗し難き勢
irresistible force
抵抗力
power of resistance―resisting power
病に対する抵抗力がある
We have power of resistance to diseases.
人が病に冒されるのは抵抗力が無いからだ
People are attacked with diseases owing to the want of resisting power.
(電気の通ずる)最少抵抗線
the line of least resistance

content:
ていこく〔定刻〕
〈名〉The appointed hour:(汽車発着の定刻) schedule time:(=に) at the appointed hour; on schedule time; on time

content.content: 会は定刻に開く
The meeting opens at the appointed hour.
この汽車は定刻に発着する
The train is on schedule time.
定刻までに間に合うか
Will it be ready by the appointed hour?
彼はいつも定刻にキチンと来る
He is always on time.
いま一人はいつも定刻に後れる
The other man is always behind time.
今日も定刻に三十分後れた
He is half-an-hour behind his time today.

The Imperial Hotel.

imperialism

an imperialistic policy

content:
ていさい〔体裁〕
〈名〉Decency; appearance; show; form; style; grace; effect; shape:(本などのは) get-up

content.content: 二頭立ては体裁が好い
A carriage and pair makes a good appearance―cuts a good figure.
一頭馬車は体裁が好くない
A one-horse carriage makes a poor appearance―cuts a sorry figure.
この洋服は体裁が好い、体裁が好くない
This coat makes a good show―makes a poor show.
体裁の好い
decent―respectable―presentable―becoming―seemly
体裁の好い家だ
It is a decent-looking house―a respectable house.
まことに体裁の好い家だ
It is a smart-looking house.
体裁の好い本だ
The book is elegantly got up.
体裁の好い新聞だ
The paper is smartly got up.
体裁の好い身形{みなり}をしている
He makes a presentable appearance.
体裁の悪い
indecent―unbecoming―unpresentable―unseemly
夫を亡くなして一年もたたぬに再婚しては体裁が悪い
It would be indecent for her to marry again before one year of her widowhood is out.
この身なりでは人前に出るに体裁が悪い
I am unpresentable―not fit to be seen.
外国人の前でお国自慢をするのは体裁が悪くないものか
Is it good form―good style―to show a pride in one's country in mixed company?
学問を見せびらかすのは体裁が悪い
It is bad form―bad style―to parade one's learning.
質問をしては体裁が悪い
I could not with any grace ask questions.
体裁好く
decently―with decency
体裁好くできない
It can not be done with any decency.
体裁を好くする
to smart up a house―make a room look nice
体裁をつくろう
to save appearances
彼は小僧を叱って体裁をつくろった
He scolded the shop-boy to save appearances.
体裁を飾る
to keep up appearances
彼は体裁の好いことを言っている
He says such things to keep up appearances.
彼は体裁を飾りたがる
He loves effect―strives after effect.
体裁を飾りたがること
love of effect
彼は体裁を飾るからせっかくの善行も無になってしまう
His love of effect spoils all his good works.
彼は体裁ということにはさらに構わぬ
He has no regard to appearance or decency.
体裁に
for appearance' sake―for manners' sake―for effect
英国人は体裁に教会へ行く
Englishmen go to church for appearance' sake.
ご馳走は体裁に少し残すものだ
You should leave some for manners' sake.
彼は何事も体裁にする
He does everything for effect.
何の体裁を成している
to be in shape
あの学校は学校の体裁を成しておらぬ
The school is not in shape.
役所は役所の体裁を成しておらぬ
The offices are not in shape.→『ていさいぶる〔体裁振る〕』

content:
ていさいぶる〔体裁振る〕
〈自動〉To give oneself airs; to put on airs

content.content: 体裁ぶって事をする
to put style into anything
彼にやらしたらもっと体裁ぶってやるところだ
He would put more style into it.

ていさつ〔偵察〕
〈名〉Reconnaissance; scouting:(=する) to reconnoitre; to scout

content.content: 敵情を偵察する
to reconnoitre the enemy―feel the enemy
将校は偵察中であった
The officer was out scouting―on the scout.
偵察に行く
to go scouting
彼の隊は敵情偵察の任務を帯びておった
His party was on scouting service―on reconnoitring service.
偵察隊
a reconnoitring party―a patrol
偵察艦
a scout
偵察飛行に行く
to go on a scouting flight
強行偵察
a reconnaissance in force

〈名〉Suspension; temporary prohibition; ban; abeyance:(=する) to suspend; to prohibit for a time

content.content: 発行停止
suspension of publication
新聞の発行を停止する
to suspend the publication of a paper―place a paper under the ban
発行停止になる
The publication is suspended―The paper is placed under the ban.
新聞は発行停止中
The paper is in suspension―under the ban.
発行停止を解く
to remove the suspension of publication
営業停止
suspension of business
営業を停止する
to suspend business
公権停止
suspension of civil rights
公権停止中
The civil rights are in abeyance.
支払い停止
suspension of payment
支払いを停止する
to suspend payment
議事停止
suspension of proceedings
議事を停止する
to suspend proceedings
議員の出席停止

議員の出席を停止する
to suspend a member of the Diet
礼遇停止
suspension of privileges
華族の礼遇を停止せらる
to be temporarily deprived of the privileges of peerage
礼遇停止を解く
to remove the suspension of privileges
歌舞音曲停止

All musical performances are prohibited for a time.
出港停止
embargo
出港を停止する
to lay an embargo on a ship―lay a ship under an embargo
船は出港停止中
The ship is under an embargo.

content.content: ていじ〔呈示〕

人類の繁殖にしてもし底止するところ無くば地上狭隘を告ぐるに至らん
If there should be no limit to the increase of mankind, the earth would be too small.

東郷大将は丁字軍をもってロシア艦隊を迎えた

content.content: 定日までに仕事を仕上げなければならぬ

content:
ていしゃ〔停車〕
〈名〉Stoppage (of a train):(一回なら) a stop:(=する) to stop (at a station):(他動詞に用いれば) to stop (a train)

content.content: この次に停車する駅はどこですか
What is the next station we stop at?
これは緩行列車だから各駅に停車します
We are an accommodation train, and stop at every station.

A train runs without a stop.

ていしゃじょう〔停車場〕
〈名〉A (railway) station:(米国にては) a (railroad) depot

content.content: 汽車が停車場に停車する
A train stops at a station.
汽車が停車場に到着する
A train arrives at a station.
汽車が停車場を離れる
A train leaves the station―clears the station―gets clear of the station.
汽車は停車場を離れた
We are clear of the station.
停車場で逢う事になっている
We are to meet at the station.
停車場で人を見送る
to see a friend off at the station
停車場へ迎えに行く
to go to the station to meet a friend
自分の下車すべき停車場を乗り越した
I have passed my destination.
中央停車場
the Central Station―the Metropolitan Terminus
中間停車場
an intermediate station
乗り換え停車場
a (railway) junction

content:
ていしゅ〔亭主〕
〈名〉
1. (=主人) the master of the house:(宿屋などのは) the landlord:(客に対しては) the host

content.content: 亭主役をする
to act as host―officiate as host―play the host―do the honours of the house―do the honours of the table
亭主ぶりが好い
He hosts it well―He is a good host.
あの人はお客ぶりは好いが亭主ぶりが悪い
He is a good guest, but a bad host.
亭主の好きな赤烏帽子
Every man has his whims.

content: 2. (=夫) a husband; the good man; one's man

content.content: あの女は外国人を亭主に持っている
She has a foreigner for a husband―She is married to a foreigner.
あれは亭主持ちだ
She is a married woman.
(こう見えても)天下晴れての亭主がありますよ
I am a wedded wife―a lawful wife―an honest woman.
あんな男を亭主に持ったのが身の不運さ
It was her misfortune to marry such a man.
丸太でも亭主は亭主
Let him be a husband if he be a log.
亭主を尻に敷く
to henpeck one's husband―wear the breeches
米国では女房が亭主を尻に敷く
The wife wears the breeches in America.
女房の尻に敷かれる亭主
a henpecked husband
亭主の顔に泥を塗る
to deceive one's husband―disgrace one's husband―dishonour one's husband―cover one's husband with disgrace―clothe one's husband with shame
亭主が顔に泥を塗られる
A man cherishes a viper in his bosom.
顔に泥を塗られた亭主
a cuckold

粗茶呈上

content: 2. (=運命) fate; destiny

ていする〔呈する〕
〈他動〉
1. (=奉る) to present (one's compliments) ; to offer (one's congratulations) ; to pass (a eulogy, etc.)

content.content: 賀辞を呈す、祝辞を呈す
to offer one's congratulations―present one's compliments
讃辞を呈す
to pass a eulogy on a person or his work―compliment one on one's success
卑見を呈す
I shall offer my humble opinion―submit a suggestion.
(失礼を顧みず)一書を呈す
I take the liberty to addressing you―I make bold to write to you.

content: 2. (=現す) to present (an appearance) ; to offer (a prospect) ; to assume (a colour) ; to develop (symptoms) ; to show (a tendency) ; to give (a reaction)

content.content: 美観を呈す
to present a beautiful sight
奇観を呈す
to present a singular appearance
洪水後の光景は極めて惨状を呈した

市は古雅の趣きを呈す

奇異なる現象を呈す

陽性の反応を呈す

市場好況を呈す

市場不況を呈す

異状を呈す

ていせい〔訂正〕
〈名〉Correction; rectification; revision:(=する) to correct; to rectify; to revise

content.content: 誤りを訂正する
to correct mistakes―rectify errors
付箋したる箇所を訂正すべし
The parts labelled are to be corrected.
作文のご訂正を乞う
I submit my composition to you for correction―I beg you will look over my composition.
版を訂正する
to revise an edition
訂正版
a revised edition

ていせいぶんせき〔定性分析〕
〈名〉Qualitative analysis

content:
ていせつ〔貞節〕
〈名〉Chastity; (female) honour; (feminine) virtue; (a girl's) virginity, maidenhead:(男に対する貞節は) constancy:(夫に対する貞節は) fidelity:(=なる) chaste (woman); virtuous (lady); constant (mistress); faithful (wife)

content.content: 貞節な妻だ
She is a faithful wife―faithful to her husband.
貞節ある女
a chaste woman―a virtuous lady―a constant mistress
貞節の無い女
an unchaste woman―a frail woman―a profligate woman
貞節の亀鑑だ
She is a pattern of female honour―a paragon of feminine virtue.
貞節の高い婦人だ
She is the soul of honour.
貞節を守る
to preserve one's chastity―remain faithful to a husband―remain constant to a lover
若後家は亡夫に対して貞節を守った
She remained faithful to the memory of her husband.
貞節を破る
to lose one's chastity―stray from the path of virtue―be false to one's husband or lover
女は一度貞操を破ると一生のキズ物だ
If a woman once loses her chastity, she is ruined for life.
貞節を売る
to sell one's chastity―prostitute oneself

ていせつ〔定説〕
〈名〉(世間のは) an established theory:(自己のは) a settled conviction

content:
ていせん〔停船〕
〈名〉Stoppage (of a ship):(検疫のためなら) quarantine:(=する) to come to (the wind); to lie to; to heave to:(他動詞に用いれば) to bring (a ship) to; to quarantine (a ship)

content.content: 港口に停船して水先を待った
We lay to at the harbour entrance for a pilot.
軍艦が商船の船首に向けて大砲を一発放って停船を命じた
The warship sent a shot across the bows of the merchantman to bring her to.
停船を命ぜられた
We were ordered to lie to―brought to.
検疫のため停船を命ずる
to quarantine a ship
一週間停船を命ぜられた
We were quarantined for a week.

content:
ていぜん〔庭前〕
〈副〉In one's garden

content.content: 庭前の梅
the plum-tree in my garden

content:
ていそう〔貞操〕
〈名〉Chastity; (female) honour; (feminine) virtue; (a girl's) virginity, maidenhead:(男に対しては) constancy:(夫に対しては) fidelity

content.content: 貞操の有る女
a chaste woman―a virtuous lady―a faithful wife―a constant mistress
貞操の無い女
an unchaste woman―a frail woman―a profligate woman
貞操の亀鑑だ
She is a pattern of female honour―a paragon of feminine virtue.
貞操の高い婦人だ
She is the soul of honour.
貞操を守る
to preserve one's chastity―remain constant to a lover―remain faithful to a husband
若後家は亡夫に対して貞操を守った
The young widow remained faithful to the memory of her husband.
貞操を破る
to lose one's chastity―stray from the path of virtue―be false to one's husband or lover
女は一度貞操を破ると一生のキズ者だ
If a woman once loses her chastity, she is ruined for life.
女の貞操を蹂躪する(汚す、弄ぶ)
to dishonour a woman―seduce a woman―ruin a girl―pluck a flower
女が男に貞操を捧げる
A woman surrenders her chastity to―gives herself to―a man.
貞操を売る
to sell one's chastity―prostitute oneself

ていそう〔逓送〕
〈名〉Conveyance (from stage to stage) :(=する) to convey from stage to stage

ていそく〔定則〕
〈名〉An established rule

content:
ていそくすう〔定足数〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: ていすう〔定数〕

content:
ていそしき〔定礎式〕
〈名〉Laying the corner-stone

content.content: 定礎式を行う
to lay the corner-stone
議事堂の定礎式は三月五日に行われた
The corner-stone of the Assembly Hall was laid on the 5th of March.

content:
ていたい〔手痛い〕
〈形〉Severe; hard

content.content: 手痛い打撃を蒙った
I have received a severe blow―a hard blow.
彼は投機で手痛い損をした
He has been hard hit in speculation.

content:
ていたい〔停滞〕
〈名〉Stagnation; accumulation; congestion; retention (of food in the stomach) :(=する) to stagnate; to accumulate; to conquest; to be retained (in the stomach) :(=せる) stagnant; sluggish

content.content: 市場は停滞振わず
The market is stagnant―dull―inactive―languid.
金融が停滞している
The money-market is sluggish.
貨物が停車場に停滞している
Goods have accumulated―There is a congestion of goods―at the station.
下水が停滞している
The sewerage is stagnant.
食物が胃に停滞している
The food is retained in the stomach.

ていだい〔帝大〕
〈名〉The Imperial University

content:
ていたく〔邸宅〕
〈名〉A residence; a mansion

content.content: 彼は立派な邸宅を構えた
He has built himself a fine residence.
彼は立派な邸宅を構えている
He resides in a fine mansion.
都の邸宅
a town-house
田舎の邸宅
a country-seat

content:
ていたらく〔為体〕
〈名〉A state of things; a condition of affairs; a plight; a predicament

content.content: これはなんというていたらくだ
Here is a nice state of things!
それはなんというていたらくだ
What a plight you are in!
ひと月たたぬにこのていたらく
A month has hardly elapsed when things have come to this!

content:
ていだん〔梯団〕

content.content: 攻城梯団
a siege-train

〈名〉Lowland; low ground; lowlying country

content.content: 定置機関
a stationary engine

〈名〉Fixation:(=する) to fix (a photographic plate, etc.)

content.content: (写真)の定着液
a fixative―a fixer
定着液槽
a fixing-bath
［法律］定着物
a fixture

でいちゅうのはす〔泥中の蓮〕
〈名〉A lotus out of the slime; a “rose amidst nettles”

ていちょう〔低潮〕
〈名〉The neap tide

ていちょう〔低調〕
〈名〉A low tone; the minor key

〈名〉The coxswain (of a boat); the captain (of a torpedo-boat)

content:
ていちょう〔鄭重〕
〈形〉Polite; courteous; respectful; reverent:(=に) politely; courteously; respectfully; reverently; with reverence; with respect; with courtesy

content.content: 人を鄭重に扱う
to treat one with courtesy―with respect―with consideration
鄭重な取扱い
courteous treatment―respectful treatment
長者に対して鄭重にせよ
Be respectful to your superiors!―Behave respectfully towards your superiors!
問題を鄭重に論ずる
to treat of a subject with reverence
これは鄭重に論ずべき問題だ
It is a question requiring reverent consideration.
鄭重に構える
to assume a reverent attitude
鄭重にお辞儀をする
to make a low bow

content:
ていっぱい〔手一杯〕
〈副〉With one's hands full

content.content: 仕事は手一杯だ
My hands are full―I have my hands full.
手一杯にふさがっているからこの上仕事は引受けられぬ
As I have my hands full, I can not undertake any more work.
商売を手一杯に拡げました
I have extended my business to the full.

ていていたる〔亭々たる〕
〈形〉Lofty (tree, etc.)

content:
ていてつ〔蹄鉄〕
〈名〉A horseshoe

content.content: 馬に蹄鉄を打つ
to shoe a horse
蹄鉄工
a farrier
蹄鉄術
farriery
蹄鉄所
a farriery
蹄鉄形磁石
a horseshoe magnet

content:
ていでん〔停電〕
〈名〉Stoppage of electric current; interruption of electric current:(=する) the electric current is interrupted; the electric current is cut off; the current stops

content.content: 停電だ
The current has stopped―The current is off.
電車が停電する
There is a stoppage of current on the electric car.
電車が停電したため遅刻した
I was late for school owing to a stoppage of current on the street-car.

content:
ていと〔帝都〕
〈名〉The Imperial capital; the Imperial metropolis

content.content: 帝都の復興
the reconstruction of the Imperial capital

content:
ていど〔低度〕
〈名〉A low degree; a low grade:(=の) low

content.content: 低度の熱
a low fever―a slight fever

content:
ていど〔程度〕
〈名〉Grade; standard; degree; extent; limit

content.content: 程度が高い
to be of a high grade―of a high standard
程度が低い
to be of a low grade―of a low standard
中学校の英語は程度が低い
The English of the middle schools is of a low standard.
程度の高い学校、程度の低い学校
a high-grade school―a low-grade school
中学程度の学校
schools of the middle-school grade
入学試験は中学課程の程度に合わせなければならぬ
The entrance-examinations must be adapted to the standard of the middle-school course.
程度を高くする、程度を低くする
to raise the standard―lower the standard
損害の程度は不明である
The extent of loss is unknown.
生活程度
the standard of living―the style of living
ある程度までは譲歩してさし支え無い
I have no objection to conceding to a certain extent.
忍耐にも程度がある(忍耐のできぬこともある)
There is a limit to perseverance.
程度問題
a question of degrees―a matter of degree
そりゃ程度問題だ
That is a question, not of kinds, but of degrees―They differ, not in kind, but in degree.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: この本はここの生徒には程度が高過ぎる
The book is too difficult for the students.
支那は文明の程度が低い
China is in a low state of civilization.
知識程度
intelligence
演説家は聴衆の程度に合わすべきものだ
The speaker should adapt himself to the intelligence of his audience.

content:
ていとう〔抵当〕
〈名〉Mortgage; hypothec; hypothecation

content.content: 抵当物
a security―a pledge―a pawn―a gage―a hostage
土地を抵当に入れる
to give land as a security―give land in security for payment―mortgage land―hypothecate land
家を抵当にして金を借りた
I have borrowed money on my house―mortgaged my house.
所有地を抵当にして金を調達した
I have raised money on my estate―mortgaged my estate.
所有地が抵当に入れてある
My estate is mortgaged―in mortgage―There is a mortgage on my estate.
所有地が一万円の抵当に入っている
There is a mortgage of 10,000 yen on my estate.
抵当を取る
to take security―secure oneself from loss
抵当に取る
to take anything as security (for a loan)
彼は土地を抵当に取っている
He holds land in mortgage.
抵当を取って金を貸す
to lend money on security―lend money on mortgage
土地を抵当に取って金を貸す
to lend money on land
抵当貸し
loan on security―loan against security―mortgage loan
抵当付貸金
a secured loan―a loan on security―a mortgage loan
土地抵当の貸金
a loan secured on landed property
抵当が無ければ金を貸すことが出来ぬ
I can not lend money without security―I must secure myself from loss.
無抵当貸金
an unsecured loan―a loan without security
無抵当の貸金は利子が高い
An unsecured loan requires high interest.
抵当流れ
foreclosure
抵当流れにする
to foreclose the mortgage
金を返さないと抵当流れになる
Default of payment will foreclose the mortgage.
抵当者
a mortgager
抵当権者
a mortgagee
抵当権
mortgage
根抵当
collateral security
総括抵当
blanket security

content:
ていとうへいしん〔低頭平身〕
〈名〉Prostration:(=する) to prostrate oneself; to fall prostrate; to humble oneself; to grovel (to the great)

content.content: 低頭平身して謝まれ(に相当するは)
Down on your knees!

でいどにいす〔泥土に委す〕
〈他動〉To lay (a city) in the dust; to lay (a city) level with the dust

content:
ていない〔邸内〕
〈名〉The grounds; the premises:(=に) in the grounds; on the premises

content.content: 邸内に長屋がある
There are tenements in the grounds.
家は邸内一軒立ち
The house stands in its own grounds.
家宅捜索を行ったけれども邸内に何物も発見せず
The house was searched, but nothing was found on the premises.
家宅侵入者を邸内から追い出した
I ordered the trespasser off the premises.

content:
ていねい〔丁寧〕
〈形〉
1. (=慇懃) polite; courteous; civil; respectful; mannerly

content.content: 婦人に丁寧にせよ
Be polite to the ladies!
彼は客扱いが丁寧だ
He is courteous to his guests.
長者を丁寧にせよ
Be respectful to your superiors!―Behave respectfully towards your superiors!
知らない人にものを尋ねられたら丁寧に教えてやれ
Be civil to strangers!
丁寧にものを言え
Be civil in speech!
人を丁寧に扱う
to treat one with courtesy―with respect―with consideration
どうもご丁寧に
It is very polite of you.
どうもご丁寧に、ご主人によろしくお礼申し上げて下さい
How polite of him! Please return your master my best thanks!
丁寧にお辞儀する
to make a polite bow―make a low bow
日本人は丁寧過ぎると西洋人言う
Foreigners say that the Japanese are excessively polite―polite to excess.
あの人は気の毒なほど丁寧だ
He is polite to a painful extent.
おかしいほど丁寧(ばか丁寧)だ
He is polite to a ridiculous extent.

content: 2. (=注意周到)careful; scrupulously careful; thorough

content.content: 物を丁寧に扱う
to treat things with care
書類を丁寧に調べて見た
I looked carefully over the papers.
万事に丁寧にせよ
Be careful in everything.
御註文は丁寧迅速に調達仕候
All orders (are) carefully and promptly executed.
丁寧懇切に教授す
The students are taught with scrupulous care―The teaching is thorough.
丁寧反復して教える
to inculcate a doctrine on one
ご丁寧に一々本を読んでみたのだ
He took all the trouble to read the books through one by one.

content:
でいねい〔泥濘〕
〈名〉Mire; mud

content.content: 泥濘膝を没す
The roads are knee-deep with mud.

content:
ていねん〔丁年〕
〈名〉Majority; full age; man's estate

content.content: 丁年に達する
to attain one's majority―attain one's full age―attain man's estate―come to man's estate―come of age
我が国では二十一歳が丁年だ
In Japan, people come of age at twenty-one.
彼は丁年にまだ二年足りない
He wants two years of his majority.
彼はもう丁年(丁年者)だ
He is of age―a major―an adult.
丁年未満(未丁年)だ
He is not yet of age―under age―a minor―in his minority―in his nonage.

content:
ていねん〔停年〕
〈名〉Are limit

content.content: (陸軍で)停年に達する
to reach the age-limit
停年法
the age-limit law
停年名簿
an army list (in order of seniority)
停年進級
promotion by seniority

content:
ていのいい〔体の好い〕
〈形〉Disguised; masked; plausible

content.content: 体の好い泥棒だ
It is disguised robbery―He is a wolf in sheep's clothing.
体の好い詐欺だ
It is a masked fraud.
体の好い放逐だ
It is a virtual dismissal.
体の好い強姦だ
It is committing a rape by help of money.
体の好いことを言っている
He says plausible things―talks plausibly.

content:
ていのう〔低能〕
〈名〉Low intelligence; mental deficiency; feeble-mindedness:(=の) of low-intelligence; mentally deficient; feeble-minded; backward

content.content: この子は低能でないかしら
I wonder if he is mentally deficient.
この子は低能だから手心して下さい
You must make allowances for his low intelligence.
低能児

ていのうじ〔低能児〕
〈名〉A backward child

content:
ていはく〔碇泊〕
〈名〉Anchorage:(=する) to anchor; to come to anchor:(投錨するの意味なら) to cast anchor; to drop anchor:(寄港するの意味なら) to stop at, put in at, touch as (a port)

content.content: 船が碇泊している
A ship is at anchor―She lies at anchor―She rides at anchor―She lies in port.
碇泊中の船
a ship at anchor―a ship in port
港にはいつも幾百艘という船が碇泊している
Hundreds of ships are always at anchor―anchored―in the harbour.
港内は水深くして船舶の碇泊に便なり
The harbour is deep and affords a good anchorage.
本船は Suez に碇泊して石炭を積んだ
We stopped at Suez for coal.
碇泊船
a ship at anchor―(出帆準備のためなら)―vessels on the berth
碇泊所
an anchorage―a berth―(沖にあれば)―roads―a roadstead
碇泊税
anchorage(-dues)―groundage

content:
ていはつ〔剃髪〕

content.content: 剃髪して仏門に入る
He took the tonsure, and entered the Buddhist priesthood.
剃髪してお詫びをしよう(に相当するは)
I will do penance in sackcloth and ashes do penance in dust and ashes.

content:
ていひょう〔定評〕

content.content: 世既に定評あり
The matter is acknowledged by the public―acknowledged on all hands.
彼は斯道の大家なることは世既に定評あり
It is acknowledged on all hands that he is an authority on the subject―He is an acknowledged authority on the subject.

content.content: 堤防を築く
to construct a bank―embank a river

ていまい〔弟妹〕
〈名〉One's younger brothers and sisters

content:
ていめい〔定命〕

content.content: 定命論
fatalism―determinism
定命論者
a fatalist―a determinist

content:
ていめい〔締盟〕
〈名〉Conclusion of a treaty:(=する) to conclude a treaty

content.content: 締盟国
a high contracting Power―a signatory to a treaty―(は条約を結ぶ時、一般に言えば)―a Treaty Power
締盟列国との関係ますます親密を加う
Our relations with the Treaty Powers have grown in cordiality.

content:
ていよう〔提要〕

content.content: 提要書
a handbook―a manual

content:
ていよく〔体好く〕
〈副〉Decently; gracefully; with thanks

content.content: 体好く断る
to decline with thanks
原稿は体好く断って返した
The manuscript was returned with thanks.
体好く質問することができない
I can not with any decency―with any grace―be asking questions.
(男にしつこく口説かれて) 柳に風と体好く受流している
She deftly eludes his importunities.

content:
ていらく〔低落〕
〈名〉Fall; depreciation; decline:(=する) to fall; to depreciate; to decline; to go down

content.content: 米価は低落した
The price of rice has fallen―Rice has fallen in price―Rice is down.
物価は低落しつつあり
The prices are on the fall―on the decline.
物価低落
the depreciation of prices
大低落(暴落)
a slump

content:
ていらず〔手入らず〕
〈形〉(=手の付かぬ)untouched (by man)

content.content: 手入らずの林(原生林)
a primeval forest―a virgin forest

content: 〈副〉(=手数を掛けずに) without trouble

content.content: そうすりゃ手入らずに金が儲かる
Then you can make money without any trouble at all.

content:
ていり〔低利〕
〈名〉Low interest; a low rate of interest

content.content: 低利で金を貸す
to lend money at low interest―at a low rate of interest
低利貸金
a low-interest loan
低利資金
low-interest funds―cheap money

content:
ていり〔定理〕
〈名〉A theorem

content.content: 二項式定理
the binomial theorem

content:
でいり〔出入り〕
〈名〉
1. (=ではいり)going in and out; exit and entrance; egress and ingress; entr?e:(=する) to go in and out; to have the entr?e of (a house); to be free of (a house); to frequent (a place)

content.content: 花柳の巷に出入りする
He frequents the gay quarters.
出入を許す
to permit one's visits
彼はその家に出入を許されている
He has the entr?e of the house―He is made free of the house.
あのクラブに出入りしている
He is free of the club.
出入りを差止める
to forbid one the house
彼は出入りを差止められた
He was forbidden the house.
東京に出入りする人々(の数)
the floating population of Tokyo
出入りの人
a friend of family―a habitu?
出入りの医者
the family doctor
出入りの商人
a tradesman who supplies the family
出入りの大工
the carpenter (who works for the family)

content: 3. (=金銭の出入り)income and outgo; incomings and outgoings; receipts and disbursements; revenue and expenditure

content.content: 現金出入帳
a cash-book

でいりぐち〔出入口〕
〈名〉A doorway; a gateway

でいりちょう〔出入帳〕
〈名〉The day-book, the journal (of Japanese book-keeping)

ていりつ〔低率〕
〈名〉A low rate

ていりつ〔定律〕
〈名〉
1. A fixed law
2. ［音楽］ Fixed rhythm

ていりつ〔定率〕
〈名〉A fixed rate

content:
ていりつ〔鼎立〕
〈名〉A triangular position:(=する) to be in a triangular position

content.content: 三国鼎立す
The three Powers are opposed to one another.

ていりゅう〔停留〕

content:
ていりゅうじょ〔停留所〕
〈名〉A stopping-place; a stop; a stand; a station

content.content: 電車停留所
a car-stop―a tram-stop

〈名〉A fixed quantity

content:
ていれ〔手入れ〕
〈名〉
1. (=修繕)repair:(=する) to repair (a house); to mend (shoes, etc.)

content.content: 家は手入れが行き届いている
The house is in good repair―kept in good repair.
手入れがしてないからこわれている
The house is out of repair―allowed to go out of repair.
手入れをしなければならぬ
The house wants repairing―(は英、米は)―needs repairing.
今手入れをしている
The house is under repairs.
この靴の手入れをしなければならぬ
These shoes must be mended―I must have these shoes mended.

content: 2. (=平素の世話) care:(=する) to care for (anything); to groom (a horse); to trim (a tree); to keep (a garden well of ill)

content.content: 庭は手入れが行き届いている、手入れが届かぬ
The garden is well kept―ill kept.
手入れの行き届いた庭だ
It is a well-kept garden.
手入れの届かぬ庭だ
It is an ill-kept garden.
松は年に二度手入れをしなければならぬ
A pine-tree must be trimmed twice a year.
馬は手入れが行き届いてる
The horse is well groomed.
あの人はいつも髪や髯の手入れを怠らない
He is always well groomed.
道具は手入れが好い
The furniture is well cared for.

content: 3. (=警察の手入れ) a raid

content.content: 昨夜ばくち宿へお手入れがあった
The police raided―made a raid on―a gambling-den last night.

content:
ていれい〔定例〕
〈名〉An established usage; a precedent

content.content: 定例に反する
It is against all precedent.

ていれつしき〔定列式〕
〈名〉A determinant

content:
ていれん〔低廉〕
〈形〉Cheap; low in price; moderate in price; reasonable in price

content.content: 価は低廉だ
The price is low―The price is moderate―The price is reasonable.

ていろん〔定論〕
〈名〉(世間のは) an established theory:(自己のは) a settled conviction

content:
てうえ〔手植〕
〈形〉Of one's own planting

content.content: お手植えの松
a pine-tree of the Emperor's own planting

てうす〔手臼〕
〈名〉A hand-mill; a quern

content:
てうすい〔手薄い〕
〈形〉Short (supply); scanty (pay); scarce (article); slender (means); slight (provision, etc.)

content.content: 資本が手薄くなった
I have run short of capital―Capital is running short.
食料が手薄くなった
We are running short of provisions―Provisions are running short―getting scarce.
資力が手薄いから長く洋行はできない
I can not stay abroad long on my slender means.
給料が手薄いから暮らしに困難だろう
He must find it hard to live on his scanty pay.
城は備えが手薄だから長い籠城には堪えぬ
The castle is too slightly provided to stand a long siege.

content:
てうち〔手打ち〕
〈名〉
1. (=主君が家来を我が手に掛けること)(a lord's) putting (a retainer) to death with his own hands

content.content: 手打ちにする
I will put him to death with my own hands.
彼はお手打ちになった
He died by the hand of his lord.

content: 2. (=売買相談をまとめること)striking a bargain

content.content: これで手打ちにしようじゃないか
Let us strike a bargain!―Let us close a bargain!

content: 3. (=和解) reconciliation

content.content: もう彼と手打ちをした
I am reconciled with him―I have made it up with him―We have made it up.

content: 〈形〉(=手製の)of one's own making

content.content: これは家内の手打ち蕎麦です
This is buckwheat vermicelli of my wife's own making.

content:
ておい〔手負い〕
〈名〉A wounded man:(=の) wounded

content.content: 手負いになる
to be wounded―sustain a wound

content:
ておくれ〔手後れ〕
〈名〉Being too late; being past cure

content.content: 病気(病人)は手後れになった
The discase is past cure―The patient is past cure.
治療が手後れになった
He was not treated in time―not attended to in time.
彼は病気をこれしきのことと思っているうちに手後れになった
He made light of his illness, till it was too late.
早速病気(病人)の手当てをしないと手後れになる
The case calls for prompt treatment―The patient requires prompt attention.
手後れになったら駄目だ
If he is not treated in time, it is all up with him.

content:
ておけ〔手桶〕
〈名〉A pail; a bucket

content.content: 水一手桶
a pail of water

ておしぐるま〔手押車〕
〈名〉A handbarrow; a wheelbarrow

content:
ておち〔手落ち〕
〈名〉An omission; an oversight; a slip; neglect

content.content: それは僕の手落ちだった
It was an oversight on my part―I ought to have done it.
金を調べなかったのが手落ちだ
I ought to have counted the money.
その人の名を聞かなかったのが手落ちだ
You ought to have asked the man's name.
手落ちの無いように頼む
See that nothing is omitted!
こちらには何一つ手落ちは無い
Nothing has been omitted on our part―Nothing has been overlooked on our part―Nothing has been neglected on our part.
多少の手落ちはしかたがない
Some slips are not to be helped.
万事手落ち無く運んだ
Everything has proceeded without omission.

ておどり〔手踊〕
〈名〉Japanese dancing; a posture-dance

ておもい〔手重い〕
〈形〉
1. (=容易ならぬ) serious (illness); grave (case, etc.)
2. (=手厚い) warm (hospitality); hearty (welcome); cordial (reception); handsome (reward or treatment)

content:
ており〔手織〕
〈形〉Home-woven; homespun

content.content: 手織り木綿
homespun cotton cloth
手織り機
a hand-loom

content:
てがい〔手飼い〕
〈形〉Kept by oneself

content.content: 手飼いの馬
a horse of one's own keeping

content:
てがかり〔手掛り〕
〈名〉
1. (=手を掛ける所) a hold
2. (=糸口) a clue, a clew (to one's identity); a key (to a mystery)

content.content: 探偵の手がかりが無い
There is no clue to the mystery.
秘密解決の手がかりが無い
There is no key to the mystery.
犯人の何者なるかさらに手がかり無し
There is no clue to the identity of the culprit.
質入れした時計が探偵の手がかりになった
The watch he pawned gave a clue to the police―put the police on the scent.
手がかりを得る
to find a clue
手がかりをたどって探索する
to follow up a clue

てかき〔手書き〕
〈名〉A good penman; a calligrapher

content:
てかけ〔妾〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: めかけ〔妾〕

content:
でがけに〔出がけに〕
〈副〉When one is going out

content.content: 出がけに人に来られた
I had a man come just as I was going out.

content:
てがける〔手掛ける〕
〈他動〉To have (a person or thing) under one's hand; to have (a student) under one's care; to be used to (anything); to have experience with (anything); to bring up, rear (a child)

content.content: 手がけた子ども
the child one has brought up
手がけた仕事は一番楽だ
The work one has had under one's hand―The work one is used to―comes most natural to one.
多年手がけた生徒だから気性はよく呑み込んでいる
I know his temper, for I have had him under my care for years.
彼は支那留学生を手がけたことがある
He has experience with Chinese students.

content:
でかける〔出掛ける〕
〈自動〉To go out

content.content: お出かけですか
Are you going out?
僕はめったに出かけない
I seldom go out.
散歩に出かける
to go for a walk
彼は散歩に出かけました
He has gone out for a walk―He is out for a walk.
馬で出かける
to go for a ride
馬車で出かけました
He has gone for a drive.
近々に旅行に出かける
I start on a journey shortly.
彼は大学を卒業すると漫遊に出かけた
On graduation, he set out on his travels.
ぶらぶら出かける
to go out for a stroll―stroll out
雨降りに出かける
to go out into the rain
そろそろ出かけよう
Let's be going!―Let's be jogging!

content:
てかげん〔手加減〕
〈名〉
1. (=手心) discretion; allowance:(=する) to use discretion; to make allowances (for some imperfection) ; to temper (justice, etc.)

content.content: このことは規則道りにはいかないから手加減をしなけりゃならぬ
You can not go by rule. You must use your discretion in the matter.
これからはもっと手加減をすることにしよう
I will use more discretion in future.
彼は年が若いから手加減をして下さい
You must make allowances for his youth.
君はあまり厳し過ぎるから少し手加減をしたらよかろう
You are too severe. You ought to temper justice with mercy.
君の攻撃はあまり烈しいから少し手加減をしてはどうか
Your attacks are too violent. Hadn't you better temper them with some humour?

content: 2. (=手際) skill; tact; knack

content.content: この機械は手加減ものだ
The machine requires some skill to handle.
手加減を覚えると後は楽だ
If you get into the knack, you will find the rest easy.
授業は手加減が要る
Teaching requires tact.
教師は手加減一つだ
The success of a teacher depends on tact.
あの先生は手加減がうまい
He has tact in teaching.
僕にはまだ授業の手加減がわからない
I can not get the run of teaching.
子どもは手加減次第で善くも悪くもなる(どうでも自由になる)
A child is what you make him―wax in your hands.

でかしがお〔出来し顔〕
〈名〉A triumphant look

content:
でかしたり〔出来したり〕
〈感動詞〉Well done!

content.content: あっぱれでかしたり
Bravo!

content:
てかず〔手数〕
〈名〉Trouble

content.content: 手数をかける
to give one trouble―cause one trouble―occasion one trouble―put one to trouble
お手数をかけて済みません
I am sorry to give you trouble.
お手数ながらそう願われましょうか
May I ask you to do so if it is not (giving you) too much trouble?―May I trouble you to do so?
お手数ながらこの手紙を翻訳して下さいませんか
May I trouble you to translate this letter?
少しも手数じゃありません(おやすいご用です)
It is no trouble at all.
お手数をかけては済まないから自分でしよう
I will spare you the trouble.
手数をかけぬ
to spare one trouble
手数を省く
to save (one) trouble
今度の男がよく働くのでたいそう僕の手数が省ける
My new man saves me much trouble.
この本を使うと教師の手数が省ける
The book saves the teacher trouble.
手数がかかる
to cost (one) trouble
この仕事はたいそう手数がかかります
My work costs me much trouble.
そうすりゃ手数が半分しかかからない
Then it will cost only half the trouble―save half the trouble.
貴様は手数のかかった奴だ
You are a troublesome fellow.

content:
でかす〔出来す〕
〈他動〉To get (anything) done; to get (anything) ready

content.content: (お靴はまだ出来ませんが)明日までにでかしておきます
I will get them ready by tomorrow―They shall be ready by tomorrow.

content:

〈名〉Handcuffs; manacles; darbies; irons

content.content: 手械をかける
to handcuff a man―put a man in irons

content:
でかせぎ〔出稼ぎ〕
〈名〉Emigration

content.content: 南米へ出稼ぎに行く
to emigrate to South America

でかせぎにん〔出稼ぎ人〕
〈名〉An emigrant:(出先きの方では)an immigrant

content:
てがた〔手形〕
〈名〉
1. A bill; a note

content.content: 千円の手形
a bill for 1,000 yen
(誰宛に)手形を振り出す
to draw a bill on one
誰宛にいくらの手形を振り出す
to draw on one for a sum
金が要る時はいくらでも俺に宛て手形を振り出せ
You may draw on me for any sum you may need.
手形の振出人
the drawer of a bill
手形を支払う
to honour a bill―meet a bill―clear a bill
手形の支払いを拒絶する(不渡りにする)
to dishonour a bill
手形が不渡りになる
A bill is dishonoured.
不渡手形
a dishonoured bill
手形の支払いを引受ける
to accept a bill
手形の引受け拒絶
non-acceptance of a bill
手形が満期になる
A bill falls due.
手形は来月満期だ
The bill falls due next month.
来月満期(来月払い)の手形
a bill due next month
三カ月期限の手形
a bill due in three months
手形の期限が過ぎた
The bill is overdue.
期限経過手形
an overdue bill
一覧払い手形
a bill payable at sight
一覧後三日払いの手形
a bill payable three days after sight
持参人払い手形
a bill to bearer
指図人払い手形
a bill to order
手形を切る(割引する)
to discount a bill
割引手形
a discounted bill
手形を現金に換える
to cash a bill
手形を売買する
to negotiate a bill
手形を保護する
to protect a bill
手形を呈示する
to present a bill
手形を所持する
to hold a bill
手形所持人
a bill-holder
手形を交換する
to clear bills
手形交換
clearing bills
手形交換所
a clearing-house
手形仲買
a bill-broker
手形仲買口銭
bill-brokerage
銀行手形
a bank bill
商業手形
a commercial paper―a mercantile bill
約束手形
a promissory note―a note of hand
融通手形
an accommodation bill
流通手形
a negotiable bill
為替手形
a bill of exchange―a draft
単独手形
a sole bill
組手形
a set of bills
白地式手形
a blank bill―a blank note
短期手形、長期手形
a short bill―a long bill
言葉は国の手形
One's dialect is the index of one's province.

content:
でかた〔出方〕
〈名〉
1. (=出様)(one's) behaviour, demeanour (towards another)

content.content: 先の出方次第でこちらにも料簡がある
I will deal with him according to his demeanour.
先の出方によっては殴るかも知れぬ
I may have to thrash him if he does not demean himself properly.

content:
2. (=芝居の案内者)a theatre attendant; a playhouse-man
3. (=仕出しを届ける男)an errand-boy (for carrying home dishes to order)

てがたい〔手堅い〕
〈形〉Firm; steady; solid; sound; secure; safe; reliable; trustworthy

content.content: この商売は手堅い
The business is on a firm basis―on a solid basis―on a sound basis.
手堅い商売だ
It is a safe business―a sound business.
彼の営業ぶりは手堅い
He has a sound business method.
彼は取引が手堅い
He is exact (to the cent) in his dealings.
手堅くやっていれば間違いは無い
Be steady, and all is safe―“Slow and steady wins the race.”
手堅い人だ
He is a reliable man―a trustworthy man.
手堅い店
a reliable shop
手堅い品
reliable goods―sound goods
手堅い市況
a firm market―a steady market
相場依然手堅し
The market remains as firm as ever.

でがたり〔出語り〕
〈名〉(事)singing on the stage (to which the actor suits his action):(人)a singer on the stage

content:
デカダン
〈名〉Decadence

content.content: デカダン派
the decadents
デカダン派の芸術家
a decadent

content:
テカテカ
〈副〉Brightly

content.content: テカテカ光る
to shine brightly
テカテカ光る頭
a brightly shining head

content:
てがみ〔手紙〕
〈名〉A letter; a communication:(短い手紙) a note; a billet:(文学にては) an epistle:(商業語のお手紙) your favour:(=の) epistolary

content.content: 手紙を書く
to write a letter
(彼は書けないから)手紙を書いてやった(代筆した)
I wrote a letter for him.
手紙を封ずる
to seal a letter
手紙を出す(投函する)
to post a letter
この手紙を出さして下さい
Please have this letter posted.
手紙をやっておこう
I will write a letter to him―write to him―communicate with him.
手紙をやっておいた
I have written to him―communicated with him.
彼から手紙があった
I have had a letter from him―I have heard from him.
手紙を受け取る
to receive a letter
手紙を開く
to open a letter
手紙を読む
to read a letter
手紙を読んで聞かせた
I read the letter to him.
(彼は読めないから)手紙を読んでやった
I read the letter for him.
お手紙正に拝受仕候
I have duly received your letter―(商業界にては)―Your favour (is duly) to hand.
お手紙の趣正に承知仕候
I have duly noted the contents of your letter.
手紙の文面左の如し
The letter runs as follows―The letter reads as follows:―
彼は手紙を寄越した
He has written me a letter―written to me.
無礼にもこんな失敬な手紙を寄越した
He had the insolence to write me such an impertinent letter.
手紙で知らせたか
Did you inform him by letter?
口上で知らせた者もあるし手紙で知らせた者もある
I informed some by word of mouth, and others by letter.
手紙で返事をする
I will answer you by letter.
僕に手紙が来ていませんか
Are there any letters for me?
その手紙は誰へ来たのか
Whom is that letter for?
手紙が届く
A letter reaches its destination.
手紙は学校へ宛て寄越せば届く
Your letter will find me at the school.
住所が間違っていたから手紙が届かなかった
The letter miscarried, for it was wrongly addressed.
手紙が「親展」としてある
The letter is marked “Confidential.”
手紙が「至急」としてある
The letter is marked “Urgent.”
彼とはまだ手紙の往復がある
I still correspond with him.

content:
てがら〔手柄〕
〈名〉A feat; an exploit; a merit; a meritorious deed; a distinguished service

content.content: 手柄をする
to perform a feat―perform a meritorious deed―render a distinguished service―distinguish oneself―win distinction―win one's spurs―win laurels―reap laurels
僕はこれをもって手柄とはせぬ
I do not make a merit of it―take credit to myself for it.
これは全く彼の手柄だ
The credit for it is due to him.
彼は些細な手柄を鼻にかけて到る所で傍若無人の振る舞いをする
He makes himself at home wherever he goes on the strength of a trifling service.
手柄話をする
to brag of one's deeds―fight one's battles over again
手柄顔で物語った
He told his story with a triumphant air.
お手柄、お手柄(!)
Well done!

てがら〔手絡〕
〈名〉A piece of cloth for woman's hair

でがら〔出殻〕
〈名〉(茶などの出殻)(tea or coffee) grounds:(繭の出殻)a pierced cocoon

content:
てがる〔手軽〕
〈形〉Light; easy; cheap; informal:(=に) lightly; easily; cheaply; informally; without circumstance

content.content: 手軽に食事をする
to take a light meal―eat a cheap dinner―dine on the cheap
もっと手軽な方法は無いか
Is there no easier way?
手軽に訪問する
to make an informal call
手軽に済ましておこう
We will do it cheap.
お手軽料理
refreshments―(米国にては)―a quick lunch
手軽料理店
a buffet―a refreshment-room―a refreshment-bar―a refreshment-counter―a chop-house

content:
てがわり〔手代り〕
〈名〉One who relieves another (at work)

content.content: 手代りが無くて困る
I have no one to relieve me at my work.

content:
でかわり〔出代り〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: でがわり〔出代り〕

でがわり〔出代り〕
〈名〉
1. (=交代)relief (of men on duty)
2. (=奉公人の入替り)going out (of old servants) and coming in (of new ones) on quarter days; change of hands

content:
てき〔敵〕
〈名〉
1. (=仇敵) an enemy; a foe; an evil-wisher

content.content: 彼は味方も多いが敵も多い
He has many friends and many enemies―He has a host of admirers and a host of detractors.
彼は味方として頼むべく敵として恐るべし
He is a powerful ally and a formidable foe.→『てきみかた〔敵味方〕』
敵になる
to become an enemy―turn against one
人は成功すると友人が敵になる
When a man succeeds in life, his friends turn against him―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Success turns one's friends against one―Success turns friends into enemies.
敵を作る
to make an enemy
君は口が悪いから敵を作る
Your tongue makes enemies.
彼の議論が多くの敵を作った
His argument raised him many enemies―brought a hornet's nest about his ears.
彼は敵の手にかかって斃れた
He fell by the hand of his enemy.
汝の敵をも愛せ
“Love your enemies.”
不倶戴天の敵
a mortal enemy―a deadly foe―a sworn enemy
恨み重なる敵
a bitter enemy
公敵
a public enemy
彼は人道の敵だ
He is an enemy to humanity―a stain to humanity.
油断大敵
Security is a great enemy.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 哲学が宗教学の敵であると思うのは間違いだ
It is a mistake to think that philosophy is antagonistic to religion.
黄金は芸術の大敵
Gold is fatal to art.

content: 2. (=敵軍) the enemy(複数無し) :(古文体にては) the foeman:(=の) hostile

content.content: 敵と戦う
to fight the enemy―engage the enemy
敵を防ぐ
to defend oneself against the enemy
敵を討つ
to attack the enemy―strike
敵に向かう
to go against the enemy―advance against the enemy―march against the enemy―send an army against the enemy
敵を迎え討つ
to go forth to meet the enemy
敵を破る
to defeat the enemy―conquer the enemy
敵線を破る(突破する)
to break through the enemy lines

to sweep the enemy from the land―clear the land of the enemy

We were attacked in front and in the rear.
日本軍の向かうところ敵無し
The Japanese carry everything before them.
皇軍の向かうところ敵無し

to turn one's back to the enemy

to go over to the enemy―desert to the enemy

to bridge a river in presence of the enemy
最後まで奮闘したのは敵ながらあっぱれ
To their honour be it said that they fell fighting to the last.
敵は本能寺に在り
He has ulterior motives.
多勢の敵
a numerous enemy

a superior enemy

敵艦
an enemy ship―a hostile ship

content: 3. (=競技、議論などの相手) an antagonist; an adversary; an opponent; a competitor; a rival; a match

content.content: 彼は敵として不足は無い

政敵
a political opponent

content:
てき〔滴〕
〈名〉A drop

でき〔出来〕
〈名〉
1. (=細工物の出来)the make, the finish, the workmanship (of an article)

content.content: この洋服の地は好いが出来が悪い

Shoes of Japanese make―Shoes made in Japan―do not wear well.

content: 2. (=作物などの出来)how (a crop) turns out; the crop

content.content: 米の出来はどうか

糸の出来は悪い

content: 3. (=人の出来)how one acquits oneself; performance

content.content: 試験の出来はどうか
How has he acquitted himself at the examination?―How has he done at the examination?
英語は出来が好い
He has done well in English.
数学は出来が悪い
He has done badly in mathematics.
これまでに無い出来だ
You have outdone yourself―eclipsed yourself.
上出来、不出来
a good performance―a poor performance
感心な出来だ
It is a creditable performance.
鮮かな出来だ
It is a beautiful performance.
出来不出来
good or bad performance―success or failure
仕事に慣れると出来不出来が無くなる
When you get used to the work, your performance will become uniform.

content: 4. (=性質)character; disposition

content.content: 出来の好い男だ
He is a man of good disposition.

content:
できあい〔出来合い〕
〈形〉Ready-made (clothes); ready-built (house); ready-cooked (food); ready-boiled, ready-broiled, ready-roasted, ready-baked (meat); cut and dried (expressions); (a man) made to one's hands

content.content: 出来合いの着物
ready-made clothes―slops
出来合いの洋服を売っている店がいくらもある

I found good teachers made to my hands.

content: 〈名〉Informal marriage; jumping over the broomstick

a couple united by mutual consent (without the intervention of a go-between)

できあう〔出来合う〕
〈自動〉(Of a couple) to unite themselves by mutual consent; to jump over the broomstick

content:
できあがる〔出来上がる〕

content.content: 本は今年中にでき上がります

〈名〉A hostile feeling; hostility; enmity; animosity:(=ある) hostile; inimical

content:

〈名〉Adaptation; accommodation; adjustment; conformity:(=する) to adapt oneself to (altered conditions) ; to accommodate oneself to (circumstances) ; to adjust itself to (the climate) ; to conform to (custom) ; to meet (the needs)

content.content: いかなる境遇にも適応する(融通の利く)人は幸福だ

日本人はよく変化に適応する(変通が利く)

適応性
adaptability
日本人は適応性に富む(変通の利く)国民だ
The Japanese are an adaptable people.

てきおうしょう〔適応症〕
〈名〉Indication

discretionary conduct

content.content: てきおう〔適応〕

〈名〉An occurrence:(大きな出来事は)an event:(小さい出来事は)an incident

できし〔溺死〕

content.content: 敵情を探る(偵察する)
to reconnoitre the enemy's movements―feel the enemy
敵と接触を保って敵情に通ずる
to keep in touch with the enemy

敵情に通ぜぬ、敵情に疎い

content:
てきする〔敵する〕
〈他動〉To turn against (one) ; to fight against (one) ; to contend against (one)

content.content: 衆寡敵し難し
There is no fighting against such odds.
彼の筆には敵し難い

彼は君には敵し得ない、とても敵し得ない
He is no match for you―not a patch upon you.

content:
てきする〔適する〕
〈他動〉To fit (one's post) ; to suit (one's taste) ; to agree (with one's constitution) ; to be fit (for service) ; to be proper (for the occasion) ; to be suited (to the person, the place, the occasion―for the purpose) ; to be suitable (for the purpose) ; to be adapted (for one―to one's needs) ; to be congenial (to one's tastes) ; to be competent (for teaching) ; to be qualified (for doing something)

content.content: その肉は食用に適するか
Is the flesh fit for food?―good to eat?
食用に適せぬ
It is not good to eat―not fit to be eaten.
この水は飲用に適するか
Is the water fit for drinking?―good to drink?
飲用に適せぬ
It is not good to drink―not fit to be drunk.
船は使用に適す(任務に堪える)
The ship is fit for use―fit for service.
彼は任に適している
He is fit for the post―suited to the office.
最も任に適している
He is the very man for the post―just the man for the post―the right man in the right place.
人と地位が互いに相い適している
The man and the post are suited to each other.
場合に適した穏当な言葉を使え
Use words proper for the occasion―suited to the occasion.
牧羊は日本に適せぬ
Sheep-farming is not suited to Japan.
日本は牧羊に適せぬ
Japan is not suited for sheep-farming.
嗜好に適する
to suit one's taste―to be congenial to one's tastes
この仕事は僕の嗜好に適している
The work is congenial to my tastes―The work is to my taste.
この本は初学者に適する
The book is adapted for beginners―adapted to the needs of the beginner.
(気候や食物が)身体に適する
to agree with one's constitution
日本の気候はおからだに適していますか
Does the climate of Japan agree with you?
豚肉は僕のからだに適さない
Pork does not agree with me.
健康に適する
to be good for the health―beneficial to health
健康に適せぬ
to be bad for the health―injurious to health
君は教師に適している
You are suited for a teacher―(生来なら)―made for a teacher―cut out for a teacher―(学力の上からなら)―competent for teaching―qualified for teaching.
意に適する
to be agreeable to one―satisfactory to one―acceptable to one
条件が少し意に適さない
The terms are not quite satisfactory to me.
これは春着に適する羅紗だ
This is a good stuff for spring wear.

てきせい〔笛声〕
〈名〉The sound of a flute

content:
てきせつ〔適切〕
〈形〉Apposite (to the case) ; appropriate (to the occasion) ; apt (to or for the purpose) ; pertinent (to the subject) ; relevant (to the matter in hand) ; happy, felicitous (expression, etc.)

content.content: これは適切な例である
This is an apt instance.
場合に適切な例である
It is an instance apposite to the case―appropriate to the occasion.
本問題に適切な言である(要領を得ている)
The remark is pertinent to the subject―relevant to the matter in hand.
適切な言葉だ
It is a happy expression―a felicitous expression.
適切な評だ
It is a happy hit.
適切な論だ
It is a pertinent argument―an argument to the point.
適切な忠告だ
It is an apt piece of advice.

content:
てきぜん〔敵前〕

てきたい〔敵対〕

できだか〔出来高〕

てきだん〔敵弾〕

content:
てきだん〔擲弾〕
〈名〉A grenade; a hand-grenade

content.content: 擲弾兵

content:
てきち〔敵地〕
〈名〉The enemy's land; the enemy's territory; the hostile country

content.content: 深く敵地に入る

content:
てきちゅう〔的中〕
〈名〉A hit:(=する) to hit the mark:(評などなら) to hit it; to hit it right; to hit the (right) nail on the head:(臆測なら) to guess right; to hit right; to make a good guess; to make a good hit; to make a good shot:(予言なら) to come true; to come out true; to turn out true:(攻撃なら) to go home:(計略なら) to take

content.content: 弾が的中した、的中せぬ
The shot hit the mark―missed the mark.
その評は的中している
The word hits it―hits the mark―hits the nail on the head.
その言は的中している
It is a happy remark―a felicitous expression.
僕の臆測は的中した
I have guessed right―made a good guess.
君の臆測は的中せぬ

予言が的中した

計略的中

攻撃が的中した

content.content: 適度の運動をする

適度に飲食する

content:
てきとう〔適当〕
〈形〉Fit (person―for the post) ; proper (conduct―for the occasion) ; fit and proper (person); fit and eligible (person); suitable (house―to the person or place―for the purpose); right (man); meet (for a man); condign (punishment); apt (instance); apposite (case―to the case); appropriate (example―to the occasion); competent, qualified (for doing something):(=する) to fit (a post); to suit (one's taste); to be suited (to the person, place, or occasion―for the purpose); to be in place

content.content: 誰か適当な人物のお心当たりは有りませんか
Can't you think of some fit person?
僕が適当な人を推薦しよう
I will recommend a fit person―a fit and proper person―a fit and eligible person―for the post.
彼は最も適当な人物だ
He is the very man for the post―just the man for the post―the right man in the right place.
この仕事には彼が最も適当だ
He is the very man for the work―just the man for the work―the right man for the work―the man for the work.
もっと適当な時を見てする
Choose some more proper occasion!
場合に適当な言葉を使え
Use words proper for the occasion―suited to the occasion.
君は教師に適当だ
You are suited for a teacher―(生来なら)―made for a teacher―cut out for a teacher―(学力の上からなら)―competent for teaching―qualified for teaching.
彼は新聞記者がすこぶる適当している
He is cut out for a journalist―Journalism is the thing for him.
どうも適当な家が無い
I can not find a suitable house.
帯に短し襷に長しで適当な人が無い
I can not find a suitable person.
ここに適当な例がある
Here is an apt instance―a case in point.
この場合に最も適当な例を挙げよう
I will cite an instance apposite to the case―appropriate to the occasion.
この辺で事の概略を述べておくのが適当であろう
Here it may not be out of place to state an outline of the matter.

content:
できない〔出来ない〕
〈形〉Impossible, impracticable (thing)

content.content: そりゃできない相談だ
That is asking the impossible.

content:
てきにん〔適任〕
〈名〉Fit for the post; suited to the post; suitable for the post

content.content: 適任者
a person fit for the post―a fit person―a fit and proper person
誰か適任者の心当たりは無いか
Can't you think of any one fit for the post?―Haven't you any fit person in mind?
彼なら適任だ
He is fit for the post―suited to the post―suitable for the post.
最も適任だ
He is the very man for the post―just the man for the post―the right man in the right place.
彼は英語教師に適任だ
He is a competent teacher of English―competent to teach English.
校長に適任だ
He is fit for the post of principal―competent to take charge of a school.
この地位は適任者の無いために明けてある
The post is left vacant for want of a fit person.
適任者を推薦しよう
I will recommend a fit and proper person―a fit and eligible person.
不適任者
a person unfit for the post―a square peg in a round hole―an image in the wrong niche
適任証
a certificate of competency

content:
できばえ〔出来栄え〕
〈名〉The result (of a process); the performance (of a task)

content.content: 上々の出来栄えだ
It is an excellent performance.
感心な出来栄えだ
It is a creditable performance.
この英訳はあっぱれな出来栄えだ
The English translation is a creditable performance.

content:
テキパキ
〈副〉Promptly; briskly; quickly; with despatch; with alacrity; with promptitude:(=した) prompt; brisk; quick; alert; business-like

content.content: 彼はテキパキ立働く
He is prompt in action―He moves with alacrity.
皆命を聞いてテキパキ働く
They act promptly at the word.
テキパキした男だ
He is a prompt man―an alert man.
なんでもやり方がテキパキしている
He has a brisk way of doing things―He has a business-like way about him.
(グズグズしていないで)テキパキやれ
Look sharp!―Look alive!

content:
てきはつ〔摘発〕
〈名〉Exposure:(=する) to expose; to lay bare

content.content: 人の悪事を摘発する
to expose a crime
誤謬を摘発する
to expose an error
人の私行を摘発する
to lay bare one's private life
同業者の過失を摘発する
to expose the error of a professional brother―give away one's pal
彼の虚言を摘発してやった
I detected him in a lie―caught him tripping.

content:
てきひ〔適否〕
〈名〉Fitness; propriety; suitability

content.content: 人の適否
the fitness of a person
処置の適否
the propriety of one's conduct
場所の適否
the suitability of a place

content:
てきびしい〔手厳しい〕
〈形〉→『

content.content: てひどい〔手酷い〕

content:
てきひょう〔適評〕
〈名〉Just criticism; a happy hit

content.content: 「成人した赤ん坊」は適評だ
“A grown-up baby” is a happy hit―It hits the nail on the head.

content:
てきふてき〔適不適〕
〈名〉Fitness

content.content: 適不適を見て人を選ばなければならぬ
We must choose men by their fitness for the post.

content:
できふでき〔出来不出来〕
〈名〉Good or bad performance; success or failure

content.content: 仕事に慣れると出来不出来が無くなる
When you get used to the work, your performance will become uniform.

てきへい〔敵兵〕
〈名〉(一人なら) an enemy:(全部なら) the enemy

てきぼ〔嫡母〕
〈名〉A lawful mother

てきほう〔適法〕
〈形〉Lawful (action) ; legal (capacity) ; legitimate (conclusion, etc.)

できぼし〔出来星〕
〈名〉An upstart; a parvenu

content:
てきほんしゅぎ〔敵本主義〕
〈名〉Having ulterior motives; a make-believe; a pretence; a feint

content.content: 彼の政府攻撃は敵本主義だ
He has ulterior motives in attacking the government―His attack on the government is a make-believe.

content:
てきみかた〔敵味方〕
〈名〉Friend and foe; friend or foe; both sides; opposite sides

content.content: 彼は敵味方の区別も知らぬ
He does not know friend from foe.
敵味方とも多くの死傷があった
The casualties were heavy on both sides.
兄弟が敵味方になった
The brothers fought on opposite sides―The brothers were opposed to each other on the battlefield.
一族が敵味方に分かれた
There was a strife among the same flesh and blood―The family was divided against itself.

content:
てきめん〔覿面〕
〈名〉Swift; instant; instantaneous; immediate:(=に) swiftly; instantly; instantaneously; immediately

content.content: 天罰覿面
Swift is Heaven s vengeance.
因果は覿面だ
Retribution comes swiftly.
覿面に罰が当たったろう
You are immediately punished.
薬は覿面に利く
The medicine takes instant effect―takes immediate effect.
鼻薬の効能覿面
The bribe had an instantaneous effect.

content:
できもの〔腫物〕
〈名〉A tumour:(ねぶとの類は)a boil:(腐爛するたちなら)an ulcer

content.content: できものができる
A tumour forms ［appears, makes its appearance］ on some part of the body.
すねにできものを出した
I have a boil on my leg.
できものに口がつく
A tumour comes to a head.
できものが膿む
A tumour suppurates.
できものが膿んだ
The boil is ripe.
できものが破れる
A tumour breaks.
できものが散る
A tumour resolves.
できものを散らす
to resolve a tumour

てきやく〔滴薬〕
〈名〉An eye-water; an eye-wash

content:
てきやく〔適役〕
〈名〉A fit post; a suitable office

content.content: 今度の職は彼にとってはすこぶる適役だ
His new office is quite in character.

てきやく〔適薬〕
〈名〉A specific medicine; a specific remedy; a specific (for some disease)

content:
てきやく〔適訳〕
〈名〉An exact rendering

content.content: 一見して要領を得る適訳をつけるのは容易でない
It is no easy task to give exact renderings that are brief and to the point.

content:
てきよう〔摘要〕
〈名〉A summary; an epitome; a compendium; an outline; a syllabus; a synopsis; an abstract; a digest; a pr?cis; a r?sum?:(欄上に記せば)remarks:(=する) to summarize; to epitomize; to outline; to sum up

content.content: 摘要欄
the remarks column

content:
てきよう〔適用〕
〈名〉Application:(=する) to apply (a rule to a case)

content.content: 法律の適用
application of the law
裁判官が法律を適用する
The judge applies the law to the case.
この規則はこういう場合に適用し得る
The rule applies to such cases―The rule is applicable to such cases―The rule holds true in such cases―The rule is true of such cases.
この規則は総ての場合に適用し得る
The rule applies to all cases―The rule is applicable to all cases―The rule is of universal application―The rule always holds true―The rule is true of all cases.
この規則を適用することのできない場合がある

There are cases where this rule does not apply―There are cases where this rule does not hold true―This rule does not apply to all cases―This rule is not always applicable―This rule does not hold true in all cases―This rule is not true of all cases.
この規則はこの場合には適用し難い
The rule is inapplicable to this case―The rule does not apply to this case―The rule does not hold true in this case―The rule is not true of this case.

できょうじゅ〔出教授〕
〈名〉Visiting one's pupils:(=する) to give lessons at the pupil's homes

content:
てきりょう〔適量〕
〈名〉A proper quantity

content.content: 適量の薬
a proper dose of medicine

content:
できる〔出切る〕
〈自動〉To be all out

content.content: 自動車は出切ってありません
The motor-cars are all out―There are none left.

できる〔出来る〕
〈形〉Possible, practicable, feasible (thing)

content:
できる〔出来る〕
〈自動詞〉
1. (=何ができる)can (do something); to be able (to do something); to be in a position (to do something); to manage (to do something); to be good for (something); to be equal to (the task)

content.content: 彼は英文を読むことはできるが英語を話すことはできぬ
He can read English, but he can not speak it―He is able to read English, but unable to speak it.
僕はできるなら助けてあげるのだが
I would help you if I could―if I had the power.
僕はできるなら洋行したいのだが
I would go abroad if I could.
僕は洋行ならいつでもできる
I could go abroad if I would.
君にそんなことがどうしてできるか
How do you manage to do it?
どうにかこうにかできる
I manage to do it (somehow).
僕にできるかも知れぬ
I may be able to do it.
一所懸命にやったらできないことはあるまい
I might be able to do it if I did my utmost.
君にできないことが僕にできる道理があるか
If you can not do it, how can I be able?
遺憾ながらご依頼に応ずることはできません
I regret to say that I am not in a position to comply with your request.
彼は金があるから何でもできる
He is rich, so he can do anything―(他動詞構文にすれば)―His wealth enables him to do anything.
君は若いから働くことができる
As you are young, you can work―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Your youth enables you to work.
彼は老人だから働くことができぬ
As he is old, he can not work―(他動詞構文にすれば)―His old age disables him from working―prevents him from working.
僕は病気で来ることができなかった
I could not come on account of illness―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Illness prevented me from coming―prevented my coming―prevented me coming.
朝は来ることができなかったが晩なら来ることができたのだ
I could not come in the morning, but I could have come in the evening.
彼の名を思い出すことがどうしてもできない
I can not, for the life of me, recollect his name.
どうしてもできない
To do my utmost, I can not do it―I can not do it for the life of me―I can not do it to save my life.
どうしても僕の意を通ずることができなかった
To do my utmost, I could not make myself understood.
この病人を治すことはとうていできぬ
They can not possibly cure the invalid.
もしや治すことができるなら金はいくらかかってもかまわぬ
If they can possibly cure him, I do not mind the expense.
あの人は何ができるか
What is he good for?
何かできるだろう
He must be good for something.
何もできない
He is good for nothing.
何でもできる
He is good for anything―equal to anything.
(病人に向かって)行くことができそうかね
Do you feel equal to the journey?

content: 2. (=このことができる)can (be done); to be capable of (being done); to be possible; to be practicable; to be feasible

content.content: 金は曲げることができる
A metal can be bent―A metal is capable of being bent.
そんなことはできない
That is not to be done―impossible―impracticable.
この情ばかりは制することができない
It is impossible to control this passion―This passion is impossible of control.
できるなら
if possible―if one can―(打消に伴えば)―if one can help it
できるならそうしよう
I will do so, if possible.
できるなら借金はしない
I will not borrow money, if I can help it.
とうていできぬ
It is quite impossible―no go.
返事は延引することができぬ
The answer can not be delayed―admits of no delay.
その議論には答弁ができぬ
The argument can not be answered―permits of no answer.
この規則は変更ができぬ
The rule can not be altered―allows of no alteration.

content: 3. (=いつできる)to be done; to be finished; to be completed; to be ready

content.content: 仕事はできたか
Is your work done?―Is your work ready?
いつできるか
When will it be done?
明日までにできます
It will be done by tomorrow.
仕事ができています
My work is ready―I have my work ready―I am ready with my work.
誂えた靴ができたか
Are my shoes ready?
明後日までにできます
They will be ready by the day after tomorrow.
答案ができたら出してよろしい
You may hand in your papers if they are finished.
ご飯ができました
Dinner is ready―(召使いが言えば)―Dinner is served.

content: 4. (=何ができる) to be made; to be manufactured; to be produced; to be built; to be raised; to be grown

content.content: 紙で色々の物ができる
Various things are made of paper―Paper is made into various things.
日本で戦闘艦ができるようになった
Battle-ships are now built in Japan―The Japanese have fallen into the way of building their own battle-ships.
ドイツで日本品ができる
Japanese goods are manufactured in Germany.
麦酒はいつから日本でできるようになったか
When was the first beer brewed in Japan?
米国で米ができるようになった
Rice is now raised in America―grown in America.
ちゃんとできている
It is all ready―(洋服や靴などなら)―ready-made―(家なら)―ready-built―(食物なら)―ready-cooked―(荷造りなら)―ready-packed―(口上なら)―cut and dried
あの人は教師向きにできている
He is made for a teacher―cut out for a teacher.

content: 6. (=今は無いが追々できる)there will be

content.content: ここに公園ができます
There will be a park here.
じきにあきができます
There will be vacancy very soon.
問題ができる
I can solve the problem.
この問題は誰もできない
No one can solve this problem.
問題がやっとできた
I have solved the problem at last―succeeded in solving the problem.
英語ができる
He knows English―He is an English scholar.
あの人は英語がよくできる
He is proficient in English.
あの人は学校中で一番に英語ができる
He is the best English scholar in the whole school.
日本で一番に英語のできる人は誰か
Who is the best English scholar in Japan?
あの人は英仏独語ができる
He knows English, French, and German.
学問ができる
He is a good scholar.
今度の先生はちっとはできるか
Is the new man anything of a scholar?
ちっとはできそうだ
He seems to be something of a scholar.
ちょいと学問ができる
He is a bit of a scholar.
なかなかできる
He is very much of a scholar―a great deal of a scholar.
たいしてはできない
He is not much of a scholar―not much of a one.
ちっともできない
He is nothing of a scholar―no scholar (at all).
あの生徒はできる
He is a good student.
英語がよくできる
He is a good English scholar.
数学がよくできる
He is a good mathematician.
あの人は器用で何でもできる
He can turn his hand to anything―He is a versatile genius.
金ができる
One can raise the money―can find the means.
今日中に五百円できるか
Can you raise 500 yen in the course of the day?
金ができないから洋行を止めた
As I can not find the means, I have given up the idea of going abroad.
あの人はだいぶ金ができた
He has become rich―made a fortune.
金ができたから遊んで暮らせる
As he has grown rich, he need not work―(他動詞構文にすれば)―His wealth has raised him above the necessity of working.
子ができる
A child is born.
あの女は子ができた
She has a child.
二人の間に子ができた
They had a child between them―A child was born to them.
二人の間にできた子が有名な誰某
The fruit of their union was the famous So-and-so.
あの娘は男ができた
She has a lover.
腫物ができる
A tumour forms―appears―makes its appearance―on some part of the body.
すねに根太ができた
I have a boil on my leg.
試験はよくできたね
You have done well at the examination.
英語はよくできました
I have done well in English.
しかし数学はよくできませんでした
But I have done badly in mathematics.

content:
できるだけ〔出来る丈〕
〈副〉
1. As much as possible; as much as one can:(名詞に伴えば)all possible; the greatest possible

content.content: できるだけ早く来い
Come as early as you can―as soon as possible.
できるだけ早く仕事をしまって下さい
Please finish the work as early as possible―at your earliest convenience.
できるだけ早く返事をして下さい
Give me your earliest possible answer.
できるだけ急いで下さい
Make all possible haste.
できるだけ急いで帰れ
Make all possible haste home―Make the best of your way home.
この家をできるだけ好い値に売って下さい
Please sell the house at the best possible price.
できるだけ多く果物を食え
Eat as much fruit as you can―as many fruits as you can.
できるだけ気をつけよ
Take as much care as you can―Use the greatest possible care.
できるだけ運動をせよ
Take as much exercise as you can.
できるだけ早く走って来た
I ran as fast as I could―as fast as my legs could carry me.
できるだけやってみよう
I will do all I can―do my best.
できるだけ来るようにしよう
I will try my best to come.
(こんな機会はめったに無いから)できるだけ利用せよ
You must make the most of this opportunity.
できるだけのことをする
to do one's best―do one's utmost

content: 2. (打消に伴えば)as little as one can; no more than one can help

content.content: できるだけ金を借りるな
Borrow as little money as you can―no more money than you can―no more money than you can help(=not more money than you can not help borrowing)
彼はできるだけものを言わぬ
He speaks as little as he can―no more than he can help.
できるだけお手数をかけません
I will give you no more trouble than I can help.
できるだけぜいたくをするな
Be no more extravagant than you can help.
彼はできるだけ金を出さない工夫をしている
He tries to give no more money than he can help.

content:
できるなら〔出来るなら〕
〈副〉If possible; if one can:(打消しに伴えば)if one can help it

content.content: できるなら助けてあげたいのだが
I would help you if I could―if I knew how―if I had the power.
できるなら今日中に帰れ
Be back in the course of the day if you can―if possible.
できるなら借金するな
Do not run into debt if you can help it―Keep out of the debt if you can.
できるならものを言うな
Do no speak if you can help it―Be silent if you can.

content:
てきれ〔手切れ〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: てぎれ〔手切れ〕

content:
てぎれ〔手切れ〕
〈名〉Severance of connections

content.content: 二人は手切れになった
They have severed connections with each other―He has cut connections with her.
手切れ話が持上がっている
There is a proposal for cutting connections.
手切れ金
a solatium (to ensure severed connections)

content:
てきれい〔適例〕
〈名〉A good example; an apposite example; an apt instance; a case in point

content.content: ここに適例がある
Here is a case in point.
彼は適例を引いて例証した
He cited apt instances to illustrate his point.

content:
てきれい〔適齢〕
〈名〉The conscription age; the military age

content.content: 徴兵適齢に達する
to attain the conscription age
僕は来年徴兵適齢だ
I shall be of conscription age―liable for military service―next year.

てぎれい〔手綺麗〕
〈形〉Neat, deft (performance, etc.)

content:
てぎわ〔手際〕
〈名〉
1. (=出来栄え) performance; execution

content.content: 手際が好い、手際が悪い
He has performed well―performed ill.
お手際はこんなもんじゃい
Look at my performance!
お手際あっぱれ、あっぱれなお手際
Your performance does you credit―You have acquitted yourself to your credit.
この手際なら商売人と言っても恥ずかしくない
The performance would do credit to a professional.
着想はどうでも手際は申し分無い
You may find fault with the conception, but the execution is perfect.
これまでに無い手際だ
You have outdone yourself―eclipsed yourself.

content: 2. (=巧みな扱い)careful handling; tact; skill

content.content: これは手際の要る事件だ
The matter requires tact―requires careful handling―It is delicate business―a ticklish affair.
僕の手際ではおぼつかない
My tact is inadequate to the matter.
彼は手際よくやってのけた
He has managed the matter with tact―He has shown much tact in managing the matter.
手際を見せる
to display one's skill―exhibit one's skill

できわく〔溺惑〕
〈名〉Addiction; infatuation:(=する) to addict oneself to, be addicted to (wine and woman); to be infatuated with (a woman); to be gone on (a girl); to dote on (one's young wife, etc.)

content:
てきん〔手金〕
〈名〉Earnest (-money) ; bargain-money; handsel; a deposit

content.content: 手金を打つ
to pay earnest-money―make a deposit
いくらか手金を下さい
Give me something as bargain-money.
手金を十円上げる
I will give you ten yen as bargain-money.
手金を打って契約を守らないと手金流れになる
If you do not keep to your agreement, you forfeit your handsel.

content:
でく〔木偶〕
〈名〉
1. A wooden figure
2. →『

content.content: でくのぼう〔木偶の棒〕

content:
てぐすねひいてまつ〔手薬煉引いて待つ〕
〈他動〉To eagerly watch for (anything)

content.content: 来たらばひと泡吹かしてやろうと手ぐすね引いて待った
I eagerly watched for his coming, that I might give him fits.
今や遅しと手ぐすね引いて機会を待っていた
I was eagerly watching for a chance―I was on the watch for a chance―I was on the lookout for a chance.

content:
てくせ〔手癖〕
〈名〉A habit of stealing; kleptomania

content.content: 手癖の悪い男だ
He is light-fingered―His fingers are lime-twigs―He is a kleptomaniac.
彼の手癖を直してやった
I have cured him of the habit of stealing.

content:
てくだ〔手管〕
〈名〉(Woman's) art, guile, wiles, snares, toils, coquetry

content.content: 手管の有る女だ
She is an artful woman―a coquette.
女が男を手管にかける
A girl coquets with a man―plays the coquette with a man.
女の手管にかかる
to be caught in the snares―taken in the toils―of a woman

でぐち〔出口〕
〈名〉(人の出る口)the way out; the exit:(物の出る口)an outlet

content:
てくてくあるく〔テクテク歩く〕
〈自動〉To trudge it; to hoof it; to foot it

content.content: 車が無いから雨の中をテクテク歩いて来た
As there was no ricksha to be had, I had to trudge it in the rain.

でくのぼう〔木偶の棒〕
〈名〉A (mere) figurehead; a log

content:
てくばり〔手配り〕
〈名〉
1. (=人手を配ること) disposition of men:(=する) to dispose men; to make dispositions

content.content: 要所要所に手配りする
to make dispositions at important points
口々には厳重な手配りがある
The outlets are closely guarded.
八方へ手配りをして迷子を捜した
Men were sent in all directions in search of the lost child.

content: 2. (=準備) preparations; arrangements:(=する) to make preparations, make arrangements (for something)

content.content: 会の手配りをしなけりゃならぬ
We must make arrangements for the meeting.

content:
てぐり〔手繰り〕
〈形〉(=手で繰った) spun by hand; hand-spun

content.content: 手繰り糸
hand-spun yarn

content: 〈名〉(=手の繰合) arrangement of work

てくる〔テクる〕
〈自動〉→『

content.content: てくてくあるく〔テクテク歩く〕

content:
てくる〔テクる〕

鉄道が開通している
The railway is open for traffic―The railway is in operation.
鉄道が不通になる
The railway communication is interrupted―The railway communication is broken―Railway service is paralyzed―The railway is closed to traffic―The railway is blocked―Traffic is closed on the line.

A railway will be laid ［extended］ there very soon―We shall have a railway there very soon―The place will be brought into railway communication very soon.
鉄道の便が近頃開けました
A railway has been laid ［extended］ there lately―The place has lately been brought into railway communication.
