〈名〉A protruding navel

てべん〔手弁〕
〈名〉A luncheon one brings with one from home

content:
でほうだい〔出放題〕
〈名〉Random speech; nonsense:(=に) at random; at hazard; at haphazard:(=の) random

content.content: 彼は出放題にしゃべる
He talks at random.
出放題の返事をする
He will answer at random―give a random answer.
あの人の言うことは皆出放題だ
What he says, is all nonsense.

content:
てほどき〔手解き〕
〈名〉Beginning; introduction; initiation

content.content: 好い手ほどきをした
You have made a gook beginning.
手ほどきをする(してやる)
to introduce one into―initiate one into―anything
商売の手ほどきをする
to get initiated into business
研究の手ほどきをする
to break ground on a subject
改革の手ほどきをする
to initiate a reform
英語の手ほどきをする
to begin learning English
僕はあの先生に英語の手ほどきをして貰った
He introduced me into the study of English―He instructed me in the elements of English―He was my first teacher in English.
これは英文学の手ほどきに好い本だ
This is a good book as an introduction to the study of English literature.

content:
てほん〔手本〕
〈名〉
1. (=習字の手本) a copy

content.content: 手本を見て手習いする
to practise penmanship after a copy
手本を書く
to set one a copy

content: 2. (=模範) a model; an example; an exemplar; a pattern; a paragon

content.content: 何を手本にする
to take anything for a model
僕は Macaulay を手本にした
I took Macaulay for my model.
Macaulay を手本にして英文を学んだ
I formed my English style on the model of Macaulay―after the model of Macaulay.
これを手本にして上衣をこしらえてくれ
Make my coat after this model―on this model.
手本になる、手本を示す
to set an example to others
学生の手本となれ
Set an example to other students!
彼は我々の好い手本だ
He is a good example for our imitation―We see a good example in him.
手本にならう
to imitate one's example―follow one's example
ならうべき手本
an example worthy of imitation
手本になる行い
exemplary conduct
手本になる少年
a model boy
女の手本
a pattern of female honour―a paragon of feminine virtue

content: 3. (=見せしめ) an example; a warning

content.content: 彼の堕落は学生の好い手本だ
His error is a good warning to students.
犯人をとらえたらひどく罰して手本にしてやる
I will make an example of the first offender I catch.

content:
てま〔手間〕
〈名〉
1. (=時) time

content.content: 手間がかかる
to take time
この仕事はだいぶ手間がかかる
The work takes much time―It takes long to do it.
手間が取れる
to take time―to be delayed―detained―kept long
途中で手間が取れた
I was delayed on the way.
今度の事件はだいぶ手間が取れそうだ
The case will take a long time.
お手間は取らせません
I will not detain you long―I will not keep you long.
彼はどうしてこう手間を取っているのかしら
I wonder what can detain him so long―What can be keeping him?
手間を取っちゃいかんよ
Don't be long about it!―Be quick (about it)!
手間を省く
to save time
手間つぶし
waste of time
手間仕事
a piece-work―a job
手間仕事をする
to work by the day→『てまどる〔手間取る〕』

content: 2. (=労) labour; trouble

content.content: 手間を省く
to save one trouble
この本を使うと教師の手間がだいぶ省ける
The book saves the teacher much trouble.
手間つぶし
waste of labour→『てまちん〔手間賃〕』

content:
てまえ〔手前〕
〈代名詞〉
1. (=私) I

content.content: 手前どもではもとから東京です
We have always lived in Tokyo.

content: 2. (=汝) you

content.content: 手前もか
You, too?

content:
〈前置詞相当〉
1. (=こちら) this side (the river)

content.content: 橋の先か手前か
Is it beyond or this side the bridge?
岡崎は名古屋の手前だ
Okazaki is situated this side Nagoya.

content: 2. (=誰または何に対する体裁として) due to (something); out of regard for (one's feelings); out of respect for (one's superiors); out of consideration for (a person); in deference to (one's superiors); for the sake of (decency, etc.)

content.content: 刀の手前聞き捨てにならぬ
It is due to the sword I wear that I should demand an explanation.
軍服の手前黙過することができぬ
It is due to the uniform I wear that I should demand satisfaction.
髭の手前ばかな真似ができない
It is due to his moustache that he should observe correct behaviour.
長者の手前差し控えた
I desisted out of respect for my superiors―in deference to my superiors.
姑の手前わがままができぬ
She must restrain herself out of regard for her mother-in-law.
継子を可愛がるのは夫の手前
She makes much of her stepchildren in deference to her husband.
主人の手前キリスト教を信じた
He became a Christian out of respect for his master.
世間の手前がある
We must have regard to appearance―have regard to decency.
世間の手前があるからそんなことは止して貰いたい
You must give it up out of consideration for the public―for apperarance' sake―for decency's sake―in deference to decency―Decency forbids your doing such a thing.
親類の手前そんな道ならぬことはできぬ
We must abstain from doing such wrong out of regard for our relations.
人の手前をはばかって思いとどまった
I desisted out of regard for others' feelings.
息子の手前があるじゃないか
Have you no regard for your son's feelings?
息子の手前もあるから放蕩を止してくれ
You must give up riotous living out of regard for your son's feelings.
人格の手前ぜひそうしなければならぬ
It is due to my character that I do so―I must do so to sustain my character―My character demands this of me.
誓いの手前酒は飲まれぬ
I must abstain from wine in view of my vow.

content:
でまえ〔出前〕
〈名〉Supplying dishes to order (by a restaurant)

content.content: 御料理出前仕候{おりょうりでまえつかまつりそうろう}
Dishes delivered to order.

content:
てまえがって〔手前勝手〕
〈形〉Selfish; self-willed

content.content: 手前勝手な男だ
He is a selfish man.
手前勝手ばかり言っている
He consults his own convenience only.

content:
てまえみそ〔手前味噌〕
〈名〉Self-praise

content.content: 手前味噌を言う
to sing one's own praises―blow one's own trumpet
手前味噌は辛い(に相当するは)
“All his geese are swans.”

でまえもち〔出前持ち〕
〈名〉An errand-boy (for carrying home dishes to order)

content:
でまかせ〔出任せ〕
〈名〉Random speech; nonsense:(=に) at random; at hazard; at haphazard:(=の) random

content.content: 彼は出まかせにしゃべる
He talks at random.
出まかせの返事をする
He will answer at random―give a random answer.
あの人の言うことは皆出まかせだ
What he says, is all nonsense.

content:
てまくら〔手枕〕
〈名〉Making pillow of one's arm:(=する) to make a pillow of one's arm; to pillow one's head on one's arm

content.content: 手枕をして寝た
I slept with my head (pillowed) on my arm.

content:
てましごと〔手間仕事〕
〈名〉A piece-work; a job

content.content: 手間仕事をする
to work by the day

content:
てまちん〔手間賃〕
〈名〉Charge for labour; daily wages

content.content: 手間賃を払う
to pay one for one's trouble―pay one by the day―pay one's daily wages
手間賃を取る
to receive one's daily wages―work by the day

てまつぶし〔手間潰し〕
〈名〉Waste of time; waste of labour

content:
てまとい〔手纏い〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: あしてまとい〔足手纏い〕

content:
てまとり〔手間取り〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: てまどり〔手間取り〕

content:
てまどり〔手間取り〕
〈名〉One who works by the day; a day-labourer

content.content: 手間取りをする
to work by the day

content:
てまどる〔手間取る〕
〈自動〉To take time; to be delayed; to be detained; to be kept long

content.content: 途中で手間取った
I was delayed on the way.
途中で手間取らなければとうに着いたのだ
If I had not been delayed on the road, I should have arrived long ago.
この仕事はだいぶ手間取る
The work takes much time―It takes long to do it.
今度の事件はだいぶ手間取りそうだ
The case will take a long time.
彼はどうしてこんなに手間取っているのかしら
I wonder what can detain him so long―What can be keeping him?
手間取っちゃいかんよ
Don't be long about it!―Be quick (about it!)

content:
てまね〔手真似〕
〈名〉A gesture; a gesticulation; dumb show; signs:(=する) to gesture; to gesticulate; to make gestures; to make a dumb show; to make signs

content.content: フランス人やイタリア人は手真似をして話す
The French and Italians talk with gestures―talk with gesticulation.
手真似で話す
to talk by signs
手真似をしながら話す
to suit the action to the word
手真似で示す
to make a dumb show
手真似で指図をする
to make signs―motion to one―motion one to do something
彼は僕に坐れという手真似をした
He motioned me to sit down―motioned me to a seat.
手真似で人を招く
to motion a person toward one―beckon to a person
手真似で去れと言う
to motion one away

content:
てまねき〔手招き〕
〈名〉Beckoning:(=する) to beckon (to one)

content.content: 窓から手招きする者がある
Some one was beckoning to me out of the window.
手招きに応じて行った
I went at his beckoning.

てまねく〔手招く〕
〈他動〉To beckon to (one)

content:
てまめ〔手忠実〕
〈形〉Diligent; industrious; hard-working

content.content: 手まめに働く
He works like a horse.

content:
てまり〔手鞠〕
〈名〉A soft ball (used for an indoor sport); indoor-ball

content.content: 手鞠をつく
to make a ball rebound between hand and floor―play indoor-ball
手鞠唄
a ball-playing song

content:
てまわし〔手廻し〕
〈名〉Previous preparation:(=する) to prepare beforehand

content.content: 手まわしが好いね
You are all ready beforehand.
あれは手まわしの好い人だ
He is always ready beforehand (with everything.)

てまわり〔手廻り〕
〈名〉
1. (=所持品) one's personal effects; one's personal belongings
2. (=手荷物) one's luggage(は英):(米は) one's baggage

content:
てまわりかねる〔手廻り兼ねる〕
〈自動〉To be unable to attend to (details)

content.content: そこまでは手まわりかねる
We can not attend to such details.
多忙で手まわりかねる
We are hampered by press of business.

content:
てみじか〔手短か〕
〈形〉Short; brief:(=に) shortly; briefly

content.content: なるべく手短かにお話しを願います
Please speak as briefly as possible!―Please be as brief as possible!
要点だけを手短かに述べて置きます
I shall only touch on the chief points.
手短かに言えば彼は近道をして金を得ようとしたのだ
In short,―In brief,―To be brief,―To be short,―To make a long story short,―he tried to obtain money without working for it.

でみず〔出水〕
〈名〉A flood; a freshet

でみせ〔出店〕
〈名〉A branch shop:(米国にては)a branch store

content:
てみやげ〔手土産〕
〈名〉(A caller's) present

content.content: 初めて行くのだから何か手土産を持って行かなけりゃなるまい
As it is my first call there, I must take some present with me―I can not go empty-handed.

content:
てむかい〔手向い〕
〈名〉Resistance:(=する) to resist (one); to raise one's hand against (one); to lift a finger against (one); to rise against (one); to defend oneself against (another)

content.content: 貴様は主人に手向いする気か
Dare you raise your hand against your master?
お手向いご免
Excuse my defending myself!
彼に手向いのできる者は無い
No one dare lift a finger against him.
民衆が警官に手向いした
The populace rose against justice―flew in the face of justice.

content:
てむかう〔手向う〕
〈他動〉→『

content.content: てむかい〔手向い〕
親に手向かう不孝者
You forget your duty in raising your hand against me.

content:
でむかえ〔出迎え〕
〈名〉Going or coming (out) to meet (a person):(=る) to go or come (out) to meet (a person)

content.content: 伯(叔)父が上京するので停車場まで出迎えに行ってきた
I have been to the station to meet my uncle.
停車場は出迎えの人でいっぱいだった
The station was crowded with people come to meet him.
停車場で多くの人に出迎えられた
I was met by many people at the station.
主人が自身に出迎えた
The master of the house came out in person to meet us at the door.

でむく〔出向く〕
〈自動〉To proceed (to the scene)

content:
ても
〈接尾接続詞〉Even if; though; no matter (who, what, etc.)

content.content: 槍が降っても行く
I will go even if it should rain pitchforks.
それがたとい本当のことであっても僕には何の関係も無い
Though it may be true, it does not concern me.
人はどれほど金が有っても徒食するものでない
No matter how rich a man may be,―However rich a man may be,―Be a man as rich as he will,―Be a man ever so rich,―he ought not to eat the bread of idleness.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 照っても降っても彼は散歩を欠かさぬ
In sunshine or in rain,―Rain or shine,―he makes a point of taking a walk.
そんな物は有っても無くても好い
Such things are indifferent to me.

content: 〈間投詞〉What...!

content.content: ても見事な花だね
What beautiful flowers!
ても辛気な浮世だね
What a hard world it is!

content:
でも
〈副〉
1. Even:(代用形容詞)the very:(代用代名詞)oneself

content.content: 子どもでも読める
Even a child can read it.
鬼神でもこれを見て泣く
Even the gods―The very gods―The gods themselves―Even the very gods themselves―cry over it.［注意］強声の形容詞、最上級の形容詞にはこの“even”を略すを常とす。例えば
どんな偉い人でも人間だ
(Even) the greatest man is a mortal.
どんな賢い人でも失錯はある
The wisest man will make mistakes.
どんなばかでもそれくらいのことはわかる
The greatest fool―The veriest simpleton―must know that.
どんなばかにでもわかることだ
It is obvious to the dullest understanding.
僅かの疵でもあると皆駄目になる
The least blemish will spoil the whole.

content: 〈その他〉

content.content: 一目でも好い
A single glance will do.
想像したばかりでもぞっとする
I shudder at the bare idea.
話だけでもよだれが出る
The mere recital will make your mouth water.

content: 2. Also; as well (as):(打消に伴えば)either; neither...nor...

content.content: なるほど彼は政治家でもある
Indeed, he is also a politician―he is a politician as well.
彼は軍人でもあり政治家でもある
He is a politician as well as a soldier―He is both a soldier and a politician―He is not only a soldier, but also a politician.
ペンが無けりゃ鉛筆でも好い
If you have no pen, a pencil will do as well.
それでもない
It is not that, either.
あの男は山師でもない
He is not an impostor, either.
ばかでも気違いでもない
He is neither a fool nor a madman.

content: 3. For example; for instance

content.content: 君の家では猫でも飼っておくかね
Do you keep a cat, for example?
君は何か不平でもあるのかね
Have you anything to complain of, for instance?

content: 〈以下含蓄〉

content.content: 本でも読もうかな
I think of reading.
お茶でも召上がれ
Take some tea, will you?
酒でも飲もうじゃないか
Let us have some wine.
アメリカへでも行こうかな
I think of going to America.
君は気でも違いはせんか
Are you possessed?

content: 〈接続詞〉But; yet; still:(区文に伴えば)even if; though; however; whether

content.content: でもおかしい
But it is strange.
おかしいことはおかしい、でも事実だ
It is strange, and yet it is true.
彼は無主義は無主義でも政治家は政治家で強盗ではない
He is unprincipled, it is true; still he is a politician, and not a robber.
僕はたとい金持ちでもただはいない
Even if I were rich, I would not be idle.
人はいくら金持ちでも徒食するものでない
However rich a man may be,―Though a man be ever so rich,―Be a man ever so rich,―he ought not to eat the bread of idleness.
雨天でも行く
I will go even if it should rain.
その話は嘘でも本当でも我々には関係の無いことだ
Whether it may be true or false,―Be it true or false,―True or false,―it does not concern us.
いやでもしかたがない
It can not be helped even if you do not like it.
いやでもおうでも学校へやる
You shall go to school whether you will or not.

content: 〈接頭詞〉Would-be

content.content: でも学者だ
He is a would-be scholar―a scholar in a sense.
でも紳士だ
He is a would-be gentleman―a snob.

content:
〈接尾詞〉［注意］これでも、それでも、あれでも、何でも、誰でも、いつでも、どこでも(など)。
1.

content.content: これでも一個の男子だ
I am a man, such as I am.
これでも武士か
Does he still call himself a samurai?
それでもおかしいじゃないか
But isn't it strange?
こういうとおかしいようだがそれでも事実だ
It may sound strange, but it is true for all that.
あれでも学者だ
He is a scholar in a sense―in a manner.
あれでもこっけい家だ
He is a wag in his way.
あれでも親切だ
He is kind after a fashion.
何でも
(一つ)anything―(皆)―everything
あの人は何でもできる
He can do anything.
何でも知っている
He knows everything.
何でも好い
Anything will do.
何紙でもよろしい
Any paper will do.
何でも好きなものを読め
Read anything (that) you like―whatever you like.
何でも好きな本を読め
Read any book (that) you like―whatever book you like.
あれは親類でも何でもない
He is no relation to me.
あれは役人でも何でもない
He is no official.
なんでもかでも
anything and everything
(困難があろうと危険があろうと)なんでもかでも行く
I will go at all risks―at all hazards.
どれでもよろしい
Any one will do.
どれでも好きなのをお取り
Take any one (that) you like―whichever you like.
どちらでもよろしい
Either will do.
どちらでも好きなものをお取り
Take either (that) you like―whichever you like.
誰でも
(一人)anybody―any one―(皆)―everybody―every one
誰でもよろしい
Any one will do.
そんなことは誰でもできる
Anybody can do it.
そんなことは誰でも知っている
Everybody knows that.
誰でも来い俺が相手になってやる
Let any one come, I am his man.
誰でも行きたい者は行け
Let any one go who wants to―Whoever wants to go, may.
誰でも彼でも
anybody and everybody―all the world and his wife
どこでも
(一つ)anywhere―(皆)―everywhere
どこでも好きなところへ行け
Go anywhere you like―wherever you like.
あの人はどこでも行かぬところは無い
He has been everywhere.
いつでも
(勝手)any time―(始終)―always―(必ず)―ever
いつでも好きな時に来い
Come at any time (that) you like―whenever you like.
彼はいつでも遅刻する
He is always late.
僕はいつでもこの意見を変えたことは無い
I have ever been of this opinion―ever held this view―never changed my view.

content:
でもあるまい
〈熟語〉Out of the question

content.content: 六十になって結婚でもあるまい
Marriage at sixty is―(これからしようというのなら)―out of the question―not to be thought of―(既にしたのなら)―ill thought of
病人を控えて花見でもあるまい
With an invalid to care for, a cherry-party is out of the question―not to be thought of―ill thought of.

content:
てもちぶさた〔手持無沙汰〕
〈熟語〉Not knowing what to do with one's hands; feeling awkward; kicking one's heels

content.content: タバコを飲まないと人中で手持ち無沙汰だ
One who does not smoke, feels awkward in company.
持ち慣れた扇子を取られると手持ち無沙汰だ
When I am deprived of my familiar fan, I don't know what to do with my hands.
待つ人が来ないので手持ち無沙汰であった
He was so long coming that I was kicking my heels.

content:
てもと〔手許〕
〈名〉(=手許金) money in hand; money on hand; one's pocket; one's purse; one's coffers

content.content: お手もとはいかがですか
What is the state of your coffers?
手もとがたいそう楽です
I have a well-filled purse―I am flush of money.
手許不如意
I am pressed for money―hard up (for money).
手もとから払っておいた
I paid it out of my own pocket.→『おてもときん〔御手許金〕』

content: 〈副〉(=に)(=手近に) at hand; in hand; on hand; in one's hands; in one's possession; by one

content.content: その本は手もとにある
I have the book by me.
手もとに字書が無いとつい引く気にならぬ
If I have no dictionary at hand, I am apt to neglect consulting one.
この金はいつ入用があるかわからないからいつも手もとに置きます
I keep the money at hand, for I may need it at any moment.
書類をお手もとまでさし上げておきます
I will place the papers in your hands.
その品は手もとにありますからいつでもお渡し申します
As the article is in my possession, I am ready to hand it over to you.
現金手許有高
cash in hand―cash on hand
手許有荷
stock in hand―stock on hand

でもどり〔出戻り〕
〈名〉A woman who has once been married; a divorced wife

content:
てもなく〔手も無く〕
〈副〉
1. (=ちょうど) just like

content.content: 蛙か、蛙の味は手も無く魚さ
Frog tastes just like fish.

content: 2. (=わけ無く) easily; with ease; without difficulty

content.content: 手も無くできた
It was done without any trouble―with the greatest ease.

content:
でもの〔出物〕
〈名〉
1. Something in the market; something for sale

content.content: 家作の出物がある
There is a building in the market―a house for sale.
住宅の好い出物があったら知らして下さい
If there happens to be a good residence in the market, please let me know.
格安の出物があるからお買いなさい
There is one in the market, and cheap at the price. I would advise you to buy it.
できもの〔腫物〕
出物腫物ところ嫌わず
“Necessity knows no law.”

てもり〔手盛り〕
〈名〉

2. (=自分で自分の都合の好いように計らうこと) managing matters for one's own convenience

〈名〉(One's) behaviour, demeanour, attitude (towards another)

content.content: 先の出ようを見ていよう
I will observe his attitude.
先の出よう次第でこちらにも出ようがある
I will deal with him according to his demeanour.
先の出ようによっては殴るかも知れぬ
I may have to thrash him if he does not demean himself properly.

檀那寺
the family temple

content.content: 学問を衒う
to make a display of one's learning―parade one's knowledge
精美を衒う
to refine

〈他動〉To test by comparison; to check (figures, statements, etc.)

content.content: 二人の陳述を照らし合わせと合わぬ節が有る
On checking their statements, I find them at variance with each other.

content:
てらす〔照らす〕
〈他動〉
1. (=光を射す) to shine on (anything); to throw light on, shed light on (anything); to illuminate (a hall); to light, lighten (a room); to light up (a place)

content.content: 日は世を照らす
The sun shines upon the earth.
電灯が室内を照らす
The electric light throws a light over the room.
彼が提灯をもって道を照らして案内した
He lighted me the way.
野火が天地を照らした
The prairie-fire illuminated―lighted up―heaven and earth.
その全景が月光に照らされた
The whole scene was lighted by the moon―bathed in the moonlight―flooded with the moonlight.
真理の光明が心を照らした
The truth dawned upon my mind―(にわかになら)―flashed upon my mind.
肝胆相い照らす
They are congenial spirits―in sympathy with each other.

content: 3. (=従わせる) to submit (facts to a principle―a case to the law)

content.content: 事実を原則に照らして処置する
to submit facts to a principle
犯人を法律に照らして処分する
to deal with a culprit according to the criminal code
歴史はこれらの事実に照らして読むべし
History should be read in the light of these facts.→『てらしあわせる〔照らし合わせる〕』

てらせん〔寺銭〕
〈名〉The rent of a gambling-house

〈自動〉To be bright; to be shiny

てらてらする〔テラテラする〕
〈自動〉To be bright; to be shiny

〈名〉Visiting a temple:(=する) to visit a temple for worship; to visit one's ancestral tombs

てらんぷ〔手ランプ〕
〈名〉A hand-lamp

content:
てり〔照り〕
〈名〉
1. (=日の照ること) sunshine; dry weather; a drought

content.content: 近頃は照り続きだ
We have had a long drought of late.
この夏は照りが足らない
We have not had enough sunshine this summer.

content: 2. (=光沢) lustre; gloss

てりかえし〔照り返し〕
〈名〉Reflection

content.content: 湖水の辺は照り返しで暑い
The coast of the lake is hot through the reflection of the sunlight.

content:
てりかえす〔照り返す〕
〈他動〉To reflect (light)

content.content: 湖水が日光を照り返す
The lake reflects the sunlight.
月は太陽の光線を照り返して照る
The moon shines by the reflected light of the sun―shines with a borrowed light.

content:
てりこむ〔照り込む〕
〈自動〉To shine in

content.content: この座敷は日が照り込む
The sun shines into the room.

content:
てりつける〔照り付ける〕
〈自他動〉To beat down on (one)

content.content: 日が照りつける
The sun beats down on our heads.
日に照りつけられて一日歩いた
We travelled all day with the sun beating down on our heads.

content:
てりふり〔照り降り〕
〈名〉Sunshine and rain

content.content: 照り降り共に
in sunshine or in rain―rain or shine―in all weathers
僕は照り降り共に散歩を欠かさない
Rain or shine, I make a point of taking my walk.
彼は照り降り共に欠かさず来る
He always come in sunshine or in rain.
あの魚屋は照り降り共に商売品に出る
The fish-monger goes hawking in all weathers.
あの人は照り降り共に力になってくれた
He stood by me through thick and thin.
あの人は照り降りが有る(機嫌買いだ)
He is a man of moods.
照り降り傘
an umbrella-sunshade―an en-tous-cas

content:
てりやき〔照り焼き〕
〈名〉Fish broiled with soy

content.content: 照り焼きにする
to broil fish with soy

content:
てりょうじ〔手療治〕
〈名〉Self-treatment; home treatment; doctoring oneself:(=する) to treat oneself; to doctor oneself

content.content: 手療治は危ない
It is not safe to doctor oneself.

content:
てりょうり〔手料理〕
〈名〉A dish of one's own cooking; a home-made dish

content.content: これは娘の手料理です
These are dishes of my daughter's preparing.

てーる〔両<テール>〕
〈名〉A tael

てーる〔両<テール>〕
〈名〉A tael

content:
てる〔照る〕
〈自動〉To shine

content.content: 日が照る
The sun shines.
日がかんかんと照っている
The sun is shining brightly―blazing away.
ここばかりは日が照らぬ
The sun shines everywhere―I have all the world before me.
月が煌々と照る
The moon shines brightly.
月は太陽の光線を反射して照る
The moon shines by the reflected light of the sun―shines with a borrowed light.
照るにつけ曇るにつけ心配が絶えぬ
When the sky smiles or frowns, I am never free from anxiety.→『てってもふっても〔照っても降っても〕』

content:
でる〔出る〕
〈自動〉
1. (=人が出る)to go out; to come out; to get out; to emerge; to appear

content.content: 外へ出る
to go out―come out―emerge from the house
父は朝早く出て晩遅く帰ります
Father goes out early in the morning, and comes home late in the evening.
散歩に出る
to go out for a walk
日中は暑くて出られぬ
The days are too hot to go out.
こう降っては戸の口一寸先へも出られぬ
It rains so hard that there is no stirring an inch out of doors.
庭へ出る
to go out into the garden
庭へ出ておいで
Come out into the garden!
庭へ出る戸があるか
Is there a door which opens into the garden.
学校へ出る
to attend school
役所へ出る
to go to office―(就任するのなら)―take office
法廷へ出る
to appear in court
出るところへ出てさばきを受けよう
Let us appear before the magistrate.
会へ出る
to attend a meeting―be present at a meeting
会へ出ぬ
to stay away from a meeting
舞台へ出る
to appear on the stage―appear before the footlights
旅に出る
to start on a journey
人が出る
People turn out.
たいそう人が出た
There is a great turn-out of people.
公園へたいそう人が出る
There are crowds of people in the park―The park is crowded with people―thronged with people―alive with people.
祭礼でたいそう人が出る
crowds of people go to the festival
人中へ出る
to go into society
人中へ出ることが嫌いだ
I avoid society.
奉公に出る
to go out to service―go into service
ひと足前へ出る
to take a step forward
迎えに出る
to go to meet a person
主人が自身で迎えに出た
The master of the house came out to the door in person to receive us.
世間に出る
to go out into the world―start in life
世に出る
to get on in life―come to the front
幸先好く世に出る
to get a good start in life
敵は怖がって出て来ない
The enemy are afraid to come out.
道路へ出る
to strike the road
この路を行くと停車場の前へ出ます
If you follow this street, you will find yourself in front of the station.
お前たちの出る幕じゃない
It is none of your business―no business of yours.

content: 2. (=物が出る)to come out; to come up; to appear

content.content: 人が寝静まると鼠が出る
When the people are sunk in sleep, the mice come out.
夜になると野獣が餌をあさりに出る
At night, the wild beasts come out in quest of food.
味が出る
The taste comes out.
塩を入れると味が出る
Salt brings out the taste.
お膝が出た
Your knees are out.
穂が出る
The ears come out―The ears shoot out.
稲は穂が出ている
The rice-plants are in the ear.
本が出る
A book comes out―A book is published.
ご新著はいつ出ますか
When will your new work be out?
その本は何回にも出た
The book came out in numbers―came out in instalments.
日が出る
The sun rises―The sun comes up.
月が出た
The moon has risen―The moon is up.
星が出る
The stars appear―The stars come out.
星が出ている
The stars are out.
彗星が出る
A comet appears.
昔は彗星が出ると変乱の兆しとしたものだ
The appearance of a comet was formerly regarded as a sign of some social disturbance.
色が出る、艶が出る
The colour comes out―The lustre comes out.
新聞に出る
to appear in the papers
その記事は明日の新聞に出る
The account will appear in tomorrow's paper.
その記事は今日の新聞に出ている
You will find the account in today's paper.
その記事は昨日の新聞に出ておった
I read the account in yesterday's paper.
広告が出る
An advertisement appears in the papers.
その広告は電車に出ておった
I saw the advertisement in the cars.
水が出る
Water comes out―(出水の意味なら)―The water rises―The river rises.
昨日の雨で水が六尺も出た
Yesterday's rain has made the river rise by six feet.
涙が出る
The tears come into my eyes.
思い出すと涙が出る
The thought brings the tears into my eyes.
あまり笑って涙が出た
I laughed till the tears came.
芽が出る
to come up―spring up―sprout
木の芽が出る
Trees put forth their leaves.
筍が出る
Banboo-shoots come up―spring up.
金が出る
Money goes out―(金策してなら)―to find the money
入るより出る方が多い
More goes out than comes in.
金が出る(から心配するな)
Money is forthcoming.
金が出るなら洋行するのだが
If I could find the means, I would go abroad.
風が出る
The wind rises―A breeze springs up.
火事が出る
A fire breaks out.
火事に出られた
We had a fire break out.
汽車が出る
A train leaves (the station).
汽車は今出たばかり
The train has only just left.
船が出る
A ship puts to sea―A ship sails―(小舟なら)―A boat puts off―A boat pushes off.
船はいつ出るか
When does the ship sail?
(河開きで)河に船が出た
The river is alive with boats.
(小舟で)海へ出る
to go out into the open sea
船が沖へ出る
A ship stands out to sea.
ご馳走が出る
Good cheer is provided.
ご馳走が出たから頂戴しよう
Here is good cheer on the table―let us fall to!
酒が出る
Wine is served.
酒が出ている
There is wine on the table.
茶が出る、菓子が出る
Tea and cake make their appearance.
(入れると)茶が出る
Tea steeps―Tea draws.
血が出る
to bleed―run blood
傷から血が出る
A wound bleeds.
鼻血が出る
One's nose bleeds―One bleeds at the nose.
よだれが出る
One's mouth waters―One waters at the mouth.
そんな話を聞くとよだれが出る
You make my mouth water.
鼻汁が出る
One's nose runs―One runs at the nose.
乳が出る
Milk flows.
牛の乳が出なくなる
A cow runs dry.
汗が出る
One sweats―perspires.
腫物から膿が出る
A boil runs matter.
幽霊が出る
A ghost walks the earth.
あの家は幽霊が出る
The house is haunted.
ばけもの引込め俺が出る(というような顔をしている)
He will outmonster a monster.
よく智慧が出る
He is fertile in resources.
もう智慧が出ない
I am at the end of my resources―at my wits' end.
力が出ない
My strength fails me.
火が出る
to strike fire―strike sparks
馬蹄から火が出る
The hoofs strike fire.
目から火が出る
to strike sparks out of one's eyes
顔から火が出るようだった
I felt a burning shame.
調査の結果新事実が出た
On inquiry, some new facts have come to light―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Inquiry has brought some new tacts to light.
彼は田舎訛りがちょいちょい出る
His provincial dialect crops out at times.
この品が市場に出ている
The article is in the market.
(交換手が)一千百十一番出ました
No.1111 is connected.
ぼろが出る
to be exposed―be caught tripping
どんな善い人でもその行為をくわしく調べるとぼろが出る
The conduct of the best man will not bear scrutiny.
(話しが)好く出ますね
How you run on!
暇が出る
A servant is discharged.
主人をしくじって暇が出た
He was discharged in disgrace.
この品はいくら出ましたか
What did the article cost you?
百円は出まい
It can not have cost 100 yen.
顔に出る
to appear in one's face
酒が顔に出る
Wine flushes one's face―One's face is flushed with wine.
僕は三杯も飲むと顔に出る
Three cups of wine will flush my face.
この新聞はよく出る
The paper has a large circulation.
彼は好い声が出る
He has a good voice.
声が出ない
My voice fails me.
言葉が口から出る
Words fall from one's lips―drop from one's lips.
問題が出る
A paper is set.
試験にどんな問題が出たか
What sort of a paper was set you at the examination?
品物の値が出る
An article rises in price.
あの森に追いはぎが出て物騒だ
Those woods are infested with footpads.
あの山に狼が出る
Those hills are infested with wolves.
精が出る
to work hard
好くご精が出ますね
You are always hard at work.
手が出る
Hands are held out.
ご馳走に手が出る
People help themselves to good cheer.
のどから手が出そう
One is dying for a taste.
脅かしが利かないから歎願と出た
Threats proving of no avail, he betook himself to entreaties.
乱暴に出る
to resort to violence
失せ物が出る
A missing thing is found.
木から脂が出る
A tree exudes gum―exudes resin.
出る杙は打たれる
Merit is envied―“Envy will merit as its shade pursue.”

content: 3. (=何から出る)to go out of (a house); to come out of (a room); to get out of (a house); to emerge from (the water); to proceed from (a source); to issue from (a spring); to be derived from, be traced to (some origin or source)

content.content: 家から出る
to come out of a house―emerge from a house
可哀そうに家から出かねて焼け死んだ者がある
Some poor fellows could not get out of the house, and were burnt to death.
虚報はたいがい上海から出る
Most canards proceed from Shanghai.
火事はどこから出たか
Where did the fire originate?
風呂場から出た
It originated in the bath-room.
英語の多くはラテン語から出ている
Many English words come from Latin―are derived from Latin.
多くの日本語は仏教から出ている
Many Japanese expressions are derived from Buddhism―to be traced to Buddhism.
赤心から出る言葉だ
Those words flow from the heart.
本は丸善から出た
The book was published by Maruzen.
目から火が出る
to strike sparks out of one's eyes
馬蹄から火が出る
The hoofs strike fire.
顔から火が出るようだった
I felt a burning shame.

content: 〈他動〉To leave

content.content: 学校を出る
to leave school
学校を出てから実業についた
On leaving school, he went into business.
家を出る、国を出る
to leave home
国を出てから五年になる
It is five years since I left home.
門を出る
to go out at the door

〈自動〉To dally (with a woman)

てれる〔照れる〕
〈自動〉To be abashed; to be dazed; to be put out of countenance

content.content: 証人はちとてれ気味だった
The witness had a bashful air.

content.content: てくだ〔手管〕

content:
てわけ〔手分け〕
〈名〉
1. (=人数を分けること) separation into parties; forming parties:(=する) to separate into parties; to form parties

content.content: 手分けをして迷子を捜した
We sent parties to search for the lost child―We formed search parties―We sent out search-parties.

content: 2. (=分業) division of labour:(=する) to divide (the work among the number)

content.content: この仕事は手分けしてやれば一日でできる
The work can be finished in a day if it is divided among us.

content:
てわざ〔手業〕
〈名〉Manual labour

content.content: 手業をする
to work with one's hands

content:
てわたし〔手渡し〕
〈名〉Personal delivery:(=する) to deliver (anything) personally; to hand over (anything) into one's own hands

content.content: この手紙を本人に手渡するように固く言いつかって来ました
My master has strictly charged me to give the letter into his own hands.

content:
てん〔典〕
〈名〉
1. (=祝典) a celebration; a ceremony

content.content: 華燭の典を挙げる
to solemnize a marriage-ceremony

content: 2. (=法典) a code

てん〔天〕
〈名〉
1. (=天国) Heaven:(=の) heavenly; celestial

content.content: 神は天にまします
God is in Heaven.
天の神
God in Heaven.
天にまします我らの父よ
Our Father, which art in Heaven!
天に昇る
to ascend to Heaven―go to Heaven
天にも昇る心地だった
I was in the Seventh Heaven.
天に偽りなし
Falsehood is unknown in Heaven.
天に向かって唾する
“Who spits against Heaven, spits in his own face.”

content: 2. (=天道) Heaven; Providence; God; the gods; the heavenly powers:(=の) heavenly; providential

content.content: 何事も天です、天に任すよりほかは無い
We are in the hands of God.
天に助けを乞う
to call upon Heaven to help us
天の助け
providential help―help from above
天に謝す
Thank Heaven!―Heaven be thanked!―Heaven be praised!
天のご加護あらんことを祈る
May Heaven protect you!
天の賜物
a gift from Heaven―a heavenly gift―a godsend―a boon
これ天の与えと悦んだ
I rejoiced over the godsend.
天の与えを取らざればかえってその咎めあり
“Take the good the gods provide.”
酒は天の美禄
Wine is Heaven's boon to man.
運は天に在り
“Trust in Providence.”
運を天に任せる
to trust in Providence
運を天に任せたり
The die is cast.
運を天に任して断行する
to cross the Rubicon―pass the Rubicon
(危険などに遭遇して)こういう時はもう天だ(天にお任せするよりほかに無い)
We are in Heaven's hands―in God's hands.
天なり命なり
God's will be done!―Thy will be done!
天なり命なりと諦める
to resign oneself to Heaven's will
天を楽しみ命を知る
to submit to Heaven's will
天を怨む、天を仰いで歎息する
to quarrel with Providence―accuse Heaven of injustice
天を怨むなかれ
Do not be angry with Heaven.
天を怨み人を
Never be wroth with Providence,
咎むる事はあらじ
Nor blame thy fellow-men;
我過ちと
But well reflect on thine own fault
思い返さば
Committed 'yond thy ken!
天に誓う
to swear by Heaven
天に誓って偽りではない
I call Heaven to witness―witness Heaven―that I speak the truth!
殺人の罪天に訴う
The blood of the innocents cry to Heaven for vengeance.
天に目あり
“The eye of God sleepeth not.”
天に口なし人をして言わしむ
“The voice of the people is the voice of God.”
事を図るは人に在り、事を偽すは天に在り
“Man proposes; God disposes.”
天に過ち無し
“Whatever is, is right.”
白痴と酔漢には天の特別の保護あり
“Special Providence watches over idiots and drunkards.”
天は勇者を助く
“Fortune favours the brave.”
天に則る
to walk with God
功成り名遂げて身退くは天の道なり
To succeed, to win fame, and then to retire from life, is the way of Heaven.
天を動かす、天に勝つ、天に通ずる
to move Heaven―force the event―alter fate
至誠天に通ず、一念天に通ず、赤誠天に勝つ
Zeal will force the event―“Faith will move a mountain.”
人定まりて天に勝つ
A man, when resolved, may force the event.
人衆ければ天に勝つ
Men, when united, may alter their destiny.

content: 3. (=天地の天) the heavens; the firmament:(=の) heavenly; celestial

content.content: 天地
the heavens and the earth―heaven and earth
日月は天に在り
The sun and the moon are in the heavens.
天低く地狭し
The heavens are not high enough, the earth is not wide enough (for the Japanese student).
天に二日無く地に二君無し
The heavens can not support two suns, nor the earth two masters.
仰いで天に訴え俯して地に叫ぶ
to cry to heaven and earth for vengeance

content:
でんわ〔電話〕
〈名〉A telephone; a 'phone

content.content: 電話をかける
to telephone to one―phone to one―call up a person (to the telephone)―ring up a person (on the telephone)
電話をかけたけれども通じなかった
I rang him up, but there was no reply―I could not get him on the telephone.
さっき電話をかけたら話し中であった
I rang him up a while ago, but it was engaged.
電話がかかる
to be called up to the telephone―be rung up
僕に電話がかかってきた
I was rung up.
佐藤さんお電話です
Mr. Sato, you are rung up―you are wanted at the telephone―there is a call for you on the telephone.
高橋さんから電話がかかってきました
Mr. Takahashi has rung you up.
電話があいていますか
Is nobody using the telephone?―Is the telephone disengaged?
電話がふさがっている
The telephone is engaged.
電話が通じない
The telephone does not work.
電話が混線して通じない
The wires have got crossed, and the telephone will not work―the telephone refuses to work.
(故障があって)電話が通ぜぬ
Telephone communication is interrupted.
電話が通ずる
The telephone communication is restored.
電話で話をする
to talk by telephone―talk over the wire
電話で知らして下さい
Let me know by telephone!
(交換手が)電話をつなぐ
to put one person through to another―make connections
電話を切る
(話し手なら)to ring off―(交換手なら)―disconnect
電話を引く
to have a telephone installed
電話に加入する
to subscribe to the telephone service―subscribe for a telephone
仙台に電話がありますか
Is there a telephone service in Sednai?
お宅に電話がありますか
Is there a telephone in the house?
お宅の電話は何番ですか
What is your telephone number?
電話を拝借致します
May I use your telephone?
近所に電話を借りるところは無いか
Is there no house in the neighbourhood where you can use the telephone?
自働電話
an automatic telephone―a public telephone
長距離電話
a long-distance telephone
卓上電話
a desk-telephone
無線電話
a wireless telephone―radio
電話は米国人の発明にかかる
The telephone was invented by an American.
